high (a note), loud, shrill (mn.) a high tone, loud or shrill note, TāṇḍyaBr. vii, 1, 7 (compar. -तर and superl. -तम), TPrāt.
Śikṣā, MBh. vii; Mṛcch. &c.
(fr. स्तृ/?) shining, radiant, Megh.; Amar.; Kathās. lxxiii; Sāh.
clean, clear, L.
good, excellent, well flavoured, L., Sch.
तार/ m. ‘crossing’, see दुस्-, सु-
‘saving’, a mystical monosyllable (as ओम्), RāmatUp.; ŚikhUp.; Sarvad.; Tantr.
Andropogon bicolor, L.
N. of Maṇi-rāma (author of a Comm. on Bhām.)
of a Daitya (slain by Viṣṇu), Hariv.
of one of Rāma's monkey generals (son of Bṛhas-pati, husband of Tārā), MBh. iii, 16372; R. i, iv, vi
pl. a class of gods in the 12th Manv-antara, VP. iii, 2, 33
तार/ m. [n. & (आ), f., L.] the clearness or transparency of a pearl, clear pearl, Suśr. v, 3, 19; Gīt. xi, 25
तार/ m. n. a star, L.
the pupil of the eye, L.
तार/ n. descent to a river, bank (cf. तीर, तीर्थ/), AV. iv, 37, 3; Pāṇ. vi, 3, 109, Vārtt. 1
silver, BhP. iv, 6, 27; Bhpr. v, 26, 43
rAsaka: रासक m. a kind of dance, Hcar.
(in music) a kind of measure, Saṃgīt.
रासक m. n. a kind of dramatic entertainment, Sāh.
aSmakam: अश्मक m. (g. ऋश्यादि, q.v.) N. of a son of Vasiṣṭha and Madayantī, MBh.; VP.
N. of a warrior tribe, Pāṇ. iv, 1, 173; R. &c. (cf. अवन्त्य्-अश्मकास्)
dala: दल n. (m., L.) a piece torn or split off, fragment (cf. अण्ड, चर्म-, द्वि-, वेणु-), Suśr. v, 3, 22; vi, 5, 4; Śiś. iv, 44 (ifc. f(आ). ), Naiṣ. vii, 31
a half (cf. अधर-, अहर्-, द्यु-), VarBṛS.; Suśr. i, 7; Sūryas.
‘unfolding itself’, a small shoot, blade, petal, leaf (often ifc. in names of plants), MBh.; R. &c.
दल m. N. of a prince, MBh. iii, 13178; VP. iv, 4, 47,
saMDf: सं-√ धृ P. Ā. -धारयति; °ते (impf. ep. सम्-अधारम् = -अधारयम्; pr. p. P. संधारयत्; Ā. -धारयमाण, or -धारयाण; pf. सं-दधार), to hold together, bear, carry, MBh.; R.; BhP.; to hold up, support, preserve, observe, maintain, ib.; to keep in remembrance, Pañcat.; to hold back, restrain, withstand, MBh.; R.; to suffer, endure, ib.; to hold or fix the mind on (loc.), BhP.; to promise, MBh.; to hold out, live, exist, MārkP.; to be ready to serve any one (gen.) with (instr.), Kāraṇḍ. : Pass. -ध्रियते, to resolve or fix upon (loc.), TS.; to be kept or observed, R.; -धार्यते, to be held together or borne or kept or maintained, MBh.; R. &c.
Sarvam: शर्व/ m. (fr. श/रु) N. of a god who kills people with arrows (mentioned together with Bhava and other names of Rudra-Śiva)
N. of the god Śiva (often in the later language; esp. in the form Kṣitimūrti; du. Śarva and Śarvāṇī cf. Vām. v, 2, 21), AV. &c. &c.
of one of the 11 Rudras, VP.
of a son of Dhanuṣa, VP.
pl. N. of a people, MārkP. (w.r. सर्व)
navana[m]: नवन n. (ifc. f(आ). ) the act of praising, laudation, Nalod.
mata: मत मतं-ग &c. See under √ मन्, p. 783, col. 1.
मत/ mfn. thought, believed, imagined, supposed, understood, RV. &c. &c.
regarded or considered as, taken or passing for (nom. or adv.), Mn.; MBh. &c.
thought fit or right, approved, Yājñ.; Kāv.; Kām.
honoured, esteemed, respected, liked (with gen. Pāṇ. iii, 2, 188), Ragh.; Kām.
मत/ m. N. of a son of Śambara, Hariv. (v.l. मन)
मत/ n. a thought, idea, opinion, sentiment, view, belief, doctrine, MBh.; Kāv. &c.
intention, design, purpose, wish, MBh.; BhP.
yA: 1. या (collateral form of √ 5. इ) cl. 2. P. (Dhātup. xxiv, 41) या/ति (1. pl. यामहे, MBh.; impf. 3. pl. अयुः, Br.; अयान्, Pāṇ. iii, 4, 111, Sch.; pf. ययौ/, यया/थ, यय/, ययु/ः, RV. &c. &c.; यये, Kāv.; aor. अयासम् or अयासिषम्; Subj. या/सत्, येषम्, यासिषत्, RV.; Br.; Prec. यासिषीष्ठास्, Br.; fut. याता, MBh. &c.; यास्यति, AV.; °ते, MBh.; inf. यातुम्, MBh. &c.; Ved. inf. यै/, या/तवे or °वै/; ind.p. यात्वा/, Br. &c.; -या/य, -यायम्, ib.), to go, proceed, move, walk, set out, march, advance, travel, journey (often with instr. or acc. of the way, esp. with गतिम्, मार्गम्, अध्वानम्, पन्थानम्, पदवीम्, यात्राम्), RV. &c. &c.; to go away, withdraw, retire, MBh.; Kāv. &c.; (also with पलाय्य) to flee, escape, R.; Kathās. (with क्षेमेण or स्वस्ति, to escape unscathed, Pañcat.; BhP.); to go towards or against, go or come to, enter, approach, arrive at, reach, RV. &c. &c. (with acc. often followed by प्रति, e.g. with गृहम्, to enter a house; with रिपुम् प्रति, to march against the enemy; with मृगयाम्, to go out hunting; with शिरसामहीम्, to bow down to the ground with the head; with प्रकृतिम्, to return to one's natural state; with कर्णौ, to come to the ears, be heard; with उत्सवाद् उत्सवम्, to go from one festival to another; with हस्तम् ifc., to fall into the hands of; with पथम् or गोचरम् ifc., to come within range of; esp. with the acc. of an abstract noun = to go to any state or condition, become, be, e.g. विनाशं याति, he goes to destruction i.e. he is destroyed; काठिन्यं याति, it becomes hard; द्वेष्यतां याति, he becomes hated; similarly निधनं-√ या, to die; निद्रां-√ या, to fall asleep; उदयं-√ या, to rise, said of stars &c.; sometimes also with loc., e.g. याहि राज्ञः सकाशे, go into the presence of the king, R.; or even with dat., e.g. ययतुः स्व-निवेशाय, both went home, Kathās. ; न चात्मने कृपणस्य धनं याति, nor does the wealth of the miser go to [i.e. benefit] himself, Hit.; फलेभ्यो याति, he goes to [fetch] fruits, Pāṇ. ii, 3, 14, Sch.); to go to for any request, implore, solicit (with two acc.), RV.; (with स्त्रियम्) to go to a woman for sexual intercourse, MBh.; to go to for any purpose (inf.), Bhaṭṭ.; Vop.; often with adverbs, e.g. with बहिर्, to go out, Kathās.; with अधो, to go down, sink, BhP.; with खण्डशो or दलशो, to fall to pieces, Kathās.; with शत-धा, to fall into a hundred pieces, ib.; to extend to (acc.), VarBṛS.; to last for (acc.), Hit.; to pass away, elapse (said of time), MBh.; Kāv. &c.; to vanish, disappear (as wealth), Mṛcch.; to come to pass, prosper, succeed, BhP.; to proceed, behave, act, MBh.; to find out, discover, MBh.; to receive or learn (a science) from (abl.), BhP.; to undertake, undergo (acc.), RV.; Impv. यातु, be it as it may, Hit. : Pass. यायते, to be gone or moved, MBh. : Caus. याप/यति (aor. अयीयपत्), to cause to depart, cause to go or march, dismiss, Kāv.; BhP.; to cause to go towards (acc.), Pāṇ. i, 4, 32, Sch. (cf. यापित); to direct (the gaze) towards (loc.), Bhartṛ. (v.l. पातयति); to drive away remove, cure (a disease), Suśr.; to cause to pass or elapse, pass or spend (time), MBh.; Kāv. &c.; to live (Pāli yāpeti), Divyāv.; to cause to subsist, support, maintain, Divyāv.; to induce, MW. : Desid. यियासति, to intend or be about to go, desire to proceed, MBh.; Kāv. &c.: Intens. ईयायते (?), to move, PraśnUp.; याययते, यायेति, यायाति Gr.
2. या (ifc.) going, moving (see ऋण-, एव-, तुर-, देव-या).
rA: रा (आ), f. (only L.) amorous play (= विभ्रम)

1. रा or रास् cl. 2. P. (Dhātup. xxiv, 49) रा/ति (Ved. also Ā. राते/; Impv. रिरीहि, ररास्व, ररीध्वम्; p. रराण; 3. sg. र/रते and रासते; pf. ररिम/, ररे/; aor. अ/रास्म Subj. रा/सत् &c. Pot. रासीय; Class. forms are only pr. राति; fut. राता, BhP.; रास्यति, Vop., and inf. रातवे, BhP.), to grant, give, bestow, impart, yield, surrender, RV.; &c.
madra: मद्र/ m. a country to the north-west of Hindūstan proper, or a king (pl. the people) of this c°, ŚBr. &c. &c.
N. of a son of Śibi (the progenitor of the Madras), Pur.
मद्र/ n. joy, happiness (मद्रं तस्य or तस्मै, ‘joy to him!’, cf. n. of भद्र), Pāṇ. ii, 3, 73.
aYjasam: अञ्जस mfn. straight, straightforward, honest, L.
arara: अरर/ n. a covering, a sheath, L.,
अरर/ (अस्, ई), m. f. the leaf of a door, a door, L.
a part of a sacrifice, L.
hata: हत/ mfn. struck, beaten (also said of a drum), smitten, killed, slain, destroyed, ended, gone, lost (often ibc. = ‘destitute of’, ‘bereft of’, ‘-less’), RV. &c. &c.
injured, marred, hurt, wounded (lit. and fig.), MBh.; Kathās.
hit by (instr. or comp.), Kāv.; Kathās.
visited or afflicted or tormented by, struggling with, suffering from (instr. or comp.), ŚBr.; ChUp.; MBh. &c.
(in astron.) touched, come into contact, VarBṛS.
violated (sexually, as a woman), MBh. viii, 2037
ruined, undone, hopeless, miserable, wretched (of persons and things; cf. comp.), Mn.; MBh. &c.
deprived of, lapsed from (-तस् or comp.), MBh.; R.
हत/ (अम्), n. striking, killing, hurting, W.
pata: 1. पत m. flying, falling (cf. g. पचादि and ज्वलादि).
2. पत mfn. well fed (= पुष्ट), L.
asamam: अ-सम mfn. uneven, unequal (either by birth or in surface or number), Mn. x, 73; Kir. v, 7, &c.
अ/-सम mf(आ)n. unequalled, without a fellow or equal, RV.; AV. &c.
mAram: मार m. death, pestilence, VarBṛS.; AV.Pariś.
the passion of love, god of love, Hariv.; Kāv.; Kathās.

(with Buddhists) the Destroyer, Evil One (who tempts men to indulge their passions and is the great enemy of the Buddha and his religion; four Māras are enumerated in Dharmas. 80, viz. स्कन्ध-, क्लेश-, देवपुत्र-, and मृत्यु-म्°; but the later Buddhist theory of races of gods led to the figment of millions of Māras ruled over by a chief Māra), MWB. 208 &c.
vAma: 1. वाम m. (for 2. and 3. See col. 2) the act of vomiting g. ज्वलादि
2. वाम/ mf(ई/ or आ)n. (fr. √ 1. वन्; for 1. See col. 1) lovely, dear, pleasant, agreeable, fair, beautiful, splendid, noble, RV. &c. &c.
(ifc.) striving after, eager for, intent upon, fond of Kāv.; Kathās.; Rājat.
वाम/ m. the female breast, L.
the god of love, L.
N. of Śiva, BhP.
of a Rudra, ib.
of Varuṇa, L.
(with Śaivas) = वाम-देव-गुह्य, Sarvad.
of a son of Ṛcīka, MBh. (B. राम)
of a son of Kṛṣṇa and Bhadrā, BhP.
of a prince (son of Dharma), Cat.
of a son of Bhaṭṭa-nārāyaṇa, Kṣitīś. (cf. -देव)
of one of the Moon's horses, VP.
वाम/ m. or n. a kind of pot-herb, Chenopodium Album, L.
वाम/ n. a lovely thing, any dear or desirable good (as gold, horses &c.), wealth, fortune, RV.; AV.; Br.; ChUp.
वाम/ mfn. relating to a mare, Pat. (cf. under ई f. above).

3. वा/म mf(आ)n. (perhaps originally identical with 2. above) left, not right, being or situated on the left side, ŚBr. &c. &c. (the quivering of the left eye or arm is supposed to be a good omen in women and of the left arm a bad omen in men)
reverse, adverse, contrary, opposite, unfavourable, Kāv.; Kathās.
crooked, oblique (अम् ind. sideways), BhP.
refractory, coy (in love), Sāh.
acting in the opposite way or differently, Śak. iv, 18
hard, cruel, Kāv.; Pur.
vile, wicked, base, low, bad, Kir.
वा/म m. or n. the left side (वामाद् दक्षिणम्, from the left to the right; वामेन, on the left side), Kāv.; Kathās.
वा/म m. the left hand, RāmatUp.
a snake, L.
an animal, sentient being, L.
वा/म n. adversity, misfortune, Kathās.
the left-hand practices of the followers of the Tantras (= वामाचार, q.v.), Cat.
maKa: 1. मख/ mfn. (prob. connected with √ 1. मह् or √ मंह्) jocund, cheerful, sprightly, vigorous, active, restless (said of the Maruts and other gods), RV.; Br.
मख/ m. a feast, festival, any occasion of joy or festivity, RV.; ŚāṅkhGṛ.
a sacrifice, sacrificial oblation, ŚBr. &c. &c. (Naigh. iii, 17)
(prob.) N. of a mythical being (esp. in मखस्य शिरः, ‘Makha's head’), RV.; VS.; ŚBr. (cf. also comp.)
2. मख m. or n. (?) the city of Mecca, Kālac.
mahar: महर् ind. (for महस्) the fourth of the seven worlds which rise one above the other (supposed to be the abode of those saints who survive a destruction of the world, Pur.; Vedāntas.; cf. IW. 55 n. 2).
vAta: 1. वात mfn. (for 2. See p. 939, col. 3) blown &c.
वा/त m. wind or the wind-god (pl. also ‘the Maruts’, cf. वायु), RV. &c. &c.
wind emitted from the body, MBh. iv, 117
wind or air as one of the humours of the body (also called वायु, मारुत, पवन, अनिल, समीरण), Kathās.; Suśr. &c.
morbid affection of the windy humour, flatulence, gout, rheumatism &c., VarBṛS.; Śṛṅgār.
N. of a people (see वात-पति and वाताधिप)
of a son of Śūra, ib.
2. वात mfn. (fr. √ वन्) = वनित, solicited, wished for, desired (cf. विवस्वद्-व्°)
attacked, assailed, injured, hurt (cf. 3. अ-व्° and निवात).
3. वात mfn. (for 1. and 2. See pp. 934, 939) dried up (see 1. अ-वात/).
vaya: वय m. (fr. √ वे) one who weaves, a weaver, L.
aMSaM: अ/ंश m. (probably fr. √ 1. अश्, perf. आन्-अ/ंश, and not from the above √ अंश् fictitiously formed to serve as root), a share, portion, part, party
a degree of latitude or longitude
haram: हर mf(आ, rarely ई)n. (only ifc.; fr. √ 1. हृ) bearing, wearing, taking, conveying, bringing (see कवच-, वार्त्ता-ह्°), taking away, carrying off, removing, destroying (see बल-, शक्ति-ह्°)
हर m. ‘Seizer’, ‘Destroyer’, N. of Śiva, ĀśvGṛ.; Mn.; MBh. &c.
the denominator of a fraction, division, ib.
nanAm: नना/ f. fam. expression for ‘mother’, RV. ix, 112, 3 (cf. 2. तत/)
aSam: अ/-शम् ind. ‘non-welfare’, harm, AV. ii, 25, 1; ŚBr. ii.
mAm: मा/म् acc. sg. of 3. म, q.v.
raTam: 1. र/थ m. (√ 4. ऋ) ‘goer’, a chariot, car, esp. a two-wheeled war-chariot (lighter and swifter than the अनस्, q.v.), any vehicle or equipage or carriage (applied also to the vehicles of the gods), waggon, cart, RV. &c. &c. (ifc. f(आ). )
a warrior, hero, champion, MBh.; Kathās.; BhP.
2. रथ m. (√ रम्) pleasure, joy, delight (cf. मनो-रथ)
raRaM: 1. र/ण m. delight, pleasure, gladness, joy, RV.; VS.; AV.
र/ण n. battle (as an object of delight), war, combat, fight, conflict, RV.; &c.
2. रण m. (for 1. See p. 863, col. 3) sound, noise, L.
the quill or bow of a lute (= कोण), L.
BAM: भा/ f. (आ/) light or a beam of l°, lustre, splendour, MBh.; Hariv.; Var. &c. (cf. 2. भा)
the shadow of a gnomon, Sūryas.
appearance, resemblance, likeness (ifc.; cf. अग्नि-भ, गुड-भा, तन्तु-भ)

1. भा cl. 2. P. (Dhātup. xxiv, 43) भा/ति (pr. p. भात् f. भान्ती or भाती, Vop.; Pot. भायात्, TBr.; pl. बभौ, Mn.; MBh. &c.; aor. अभासीत् Gr. Bhaṭṭ.; fut. भास्य/ति, Br. &c.), to shine, be bright or luminous, RV. &c. &c.; to shine forth, appear, show one's self, ib.; to be splendid or beautiful or eminent, MBh.; Kāv. &c. (with न, to cut a poor figure, Kathās.); to appear as, seem, look like, pass for (nom. with or without इव adv. in वत्), MBh.; Kāv. &c.; to be, exist, W.; to show, exhibit, manifest, Bhaṭṭ. (v.l.) : Pass. भायते, impers. radiance is put forth by (instr.), Bhaṭṭ. : Caus. भापयते; aor. अबीभपत् Gr.: Desid. बिभासति, ib. : Intens. बाभायते, बाभेति, बाभाति, ib.
भा [cf. √ भन्, भाष्, भास्; Gk. ϕημί, ϕάσκω; Lat. fāri &c.; Germ. Bann; Eng. ban.]
2. भा/ f. (nom. prob. भा/स्) light, brightness, splendour &c. (cf. f. of 4. भ), VS.; ŚBr.
भा/ m. the sun, L. (cf. 2. भास्).
svaram: स्व/र or स्वर/, m. (ifc. f(आ). ) sound, noise, RV. &c. &c.

tone in recitation &c. (either high or low), accent (of which there are three kinds, उदात्त, अनुदात्त qq.vv., and स्वरित, col. 3), a note of the musical scale (of which seven [rarely six or eight] are enumerated, 1. निषाद; 2. ऋषभ; 3. गान्धार; 4. षड्ज; 5. मध्यम; 6. धैवत; 7. पञ्चम [described as resembling respectively the notes of an elephant, bull, goat, peacock, curlew or heron, horse, and Koil ; and designated by their initial letters or syllables thus, नि; ऋ; ग; ष; म; ध; प], but the order is sometimes changed, षद्ज being placed first, and निषाद last), Prāt.; ŚrS.; Saṃgīt.; MBh. &c.
a symbolical expression for the number ‘seven’, VarBṛS.
a vowel (either दीर्घ, ‘long’; or ह्रस्व, ‘short’; or प्लुत, ‘prolated’), Prāt.; ŚrS.; MBh. &c.
air breathed through the nostrils, ChUp.
स्व/र (अम्), n. a musical note, Sāy. on RV. x, 146, 2
naBa: नभ m. (rather fr. √ नभ् denoting ‘bursting forth’ or ‘expanding’ than fr. √ नह् ‘connecting’, scil. heaven and earth) the sky, atmosphere (= नभस्), L.
N. of a son of Manu Svārociṣa or of the 3rd M° (together with Nabhasya), Hariv.
of one of 7 sages of the 6th Manv-antara, ib.
of a demon (son of Vipra-citti by Siṃhikā), ib.; VP.
of a son of Nala (Niṣadha) and father of Puṇḍarīka (cf. नभस्), Hariv.; BhP.
udDAna: 1. उद्-धान n. (√ 2. हा), the act of leaving, abandonment, TāṇḍyaBr.
2. उद्धान mfn. (corrupted from उद्-वान्त, उद्-ध्मात, उद्-ध्मान, BRD.) ejected, vomited, L.
उद्धान n. the act of ejecting, vomiting, L.
sTAna[m]: स्था/न n. (also said to be m., Siddh.) the act of standing, standing firmly, being fixed or stationary, AV. &c. &c.
position or posture of the body (in shooting &c.), R.
staying, abiding, being in or on (loc. or comp.), Daś.; Kām.; Hariv.; Sāh.
storing-place or storage (of goods), Mn. viii, 401
firm bearing (of troops), sustaining a charge (as opp. to युद्ध, ‘charging’), ib. vii, 190
state, condition (ifc. = ‘being in the state of’), Up.; BhP.
continued existence, continuance in the same state (i.e. in a kind of neutral state unmarked by loss or gain), continuing as or as long as (with instr.), MBh.; R.; BhP.
a state of perfect tranquillity, Sarvad.
station, rank, office, appointment, dignity, degree, MaitrUp.; Mn.; MBh. &c.
place of standing or staying, any place, spot, locality, abode, dwelling, house, site (स्थाने स्थाने or स्थाने स्थानेषु, ‘in different places’, ‘here and there’), RV. &c. &c.

a partic. Soma ceremony, ṢaḍvBr.
Euphorbia Antiquorum and another species, L.
Asteracantha Longifolia L.; white-flowering Kuśa grass, L.
N. of a mountain, R.
of an Asura, Vīrac.
of a son of Aniruddha, MBh.; Hariv.; Pur.
of a son of Viśvāmitra, MBh.
of a son of Manu Sāvarṇa, Hariv.
(with Jainas) of one of the 10 Daśa-pūrvins, L.
of a Ṛṣi, VarBṛS. (v.l. for वात्स्य)
of a minister of Narendrāditya, Rājat.
of a son of Bhūti, ib.
of a heretical king, Buddh.
व/ज्र n. denunciation in strong language (compared to thunder), R.; Sāh.; Pratāp. (cf. वाक्य- and वाग्-व्°)
a kind of hard iron or steel, L.
a partic. posture in sitting, Cat. (cf. वज्रासन)
N. of a partic. configurations of the planets and stars (in which favourable planets are situated in the 1st and 7th houses and unfavourable in the 4th and 10th), VarBṛS.
myrobalan, L.
the blossom of the sesamum or of any plant called Vajra, L.
Andropogon Muricatus, L.
= बालक, a child, pupil, L.
व/ज्र mfn. adamantine, hard, impenetrable, W.
shaped like a kind of cross (cf. above), forked, zigzag, ib.
वज्र [cf. Zd. vazra, ‘a club’.]
tAtam: तात m. (cf. 1. तत/) a father, MBh. i; R.; Vikr.; Śak. iv, 4/5 (in comp.) &c.

(ता/त) voc. a term of affection addressed to a junior [ŚBr. xiv; AitBr. vii; ChUp.; MBh. &c.] or senior [i, 6796; Ragh. &c.], addressed to several persons, MBh. i, 6825; v, 5435 (C); in the latter use also voc. pl. ib. (B); i, 6820 f.; iv, 133;
rahasa: रहस See अनु-, अव-, and तप्त-र्°.
talva: तल्व n. scent arising from the rubbing of fragrant substances, W.
lava: ल/व m. (√ 1. लू) the act of cutting, reaping (of corn), mowing, plucking or gathering (of flowers &c.), Das, Nalod.
that which is cut or shorn off, a shorn fleece, wool, hair, Mn.; Ragh.
anything cut off, a section, fragment, piece, particle, bit, little piece (अम् ind. a little; लवम् अपि, even a little), MBh.; Kāv. &c. (cf. पदाति-ल्°)
a minute division of time, the 60th of a twinkling, half a second, a moment (accord. to others 1/4000 or 1/5400 or 1/20250 of a Muhūrta), ib.
(in alg.) the numerator of a fraction, Col.
N. of a son of Rāmacandra and Sītā (he and his twin-brother Kuśa were brought up by the sage Vālmīki and taught by him to repeat his Rāmāyaṇa at assemblies; cf. कुशी-लव), R.; Ragh.; Uttarar.; Pur.
of a king of Kaśmīra (father of Kuśa), Rājat.
sahat: स/हत् mfn. mighty, strong, RV. viii, 40, 1
daSAm: दशा (आस्) f. pl. ‘Decads’, N. of 10 Jain texts (उपासक-. &c.) consisting of 10 chs. each.
दशा f. (√ दंश्?) the fringe of a garment, loose ends of any piece of cloth, skirt or hem, KātyŚr. iv, 1, 17 (ऊर्णा), Lāṭy. viii, 6, 22; Kauś.; ŚāṅkhGṛ. ii, 12, 5; Mn. &c.
a wick, Gobh. iv, 2, 32 (क्षौम-), Kum. iv, 30; Bhartṛ. iii, i
state or condition of life, period of life (youth, manhood, &c.), condition, circumstances, R.; Pañcat.; Megh. &c.
the fate of men as depending on the position of the planets, aspect or position of the planets (at birth &c.), VarBṛS.; VarBṛ.; Laghuj.
rARa[m]: राण m. n. (√ 2. रण्) murmuring, L.
ASasana: आ-श/सन n. (√ शस्), cutting up (a killed animal), RV.; AV.; ŚBr.
mAnasI: मानसी (ई), f. (with पूज) mental or spiritual devotion (opp. to मूर्ति-प्°, adoration of images), RTL. 524
daDa: दध mfn., iii, 1, 139 ‘giving’, see इडा-, इला-.
pASa: पा/श m. (once n. ifc. f(आ). ; fr. √ 3. पश्) a snare, trap, noose, tie, bond, cord, chain, fetter (lit. and fig.), RV. &c. &c.
(esp.) the noose as attribute of Śiva or Yama, RTL. 81; 290
(with Jainas) anything that binds or fetters the soul i.e. the outer world, nature, Sarvad. (cf. also, RTL. 89)
selvage, edge, border (of anything woven), ŚrGṛS.

(ifc. it expresses either contempt, e.g. छत्त्र-प्°, ‘a shabby umbrella’, or admiration, e.g. कर्ण-प्°, ‘a beautiful ear’; after a word signifying, ‘hair’ abundance, quantity, e.g. केश-प्°, ‘a mass of hair’)
tajja: तज्—ज mfn. sprung from (that i.e. from) Sanskṛt (as Prākṛt or other words), Vāgbh. ii, 2
paRam: पण m. (ifc. f(आ). ) play, gaming, playing for a stake, a bet or a wager (with gen.; loc. or ifc.; पणं-√ कृ, to make a bet; पणे नि-√ अस्, to stake at play), Yājñ.; MBh.; R. &c.
a compact, stipulation, agreement, treaty, Kathās.; Vet.; Hit.
the thing staked or the sum played for, wages, hire, reward, MBh.; Mṛcch.; Kathās.
a weight of copper used as a coin (= 20 Māṣas = 4 Kākinīs), Mn.; Yājñ.
a partic. measure, Pāṇ. iii, 3, 66 (‘a handful’ Sch.)
a house, dwelling (गृह w.r. for ग्लह?), L.
vamam: वम mf(ई)n. vomiting, ejecting, giving out, W.
IriRam: ईरिण n. salt and barren soil (see इरिण), MBh.
asya: 1. अ the first letter of the alphabet
the first short vowel inherent in consonants.
2. अ (प्रगृह्य, q.v.), a vocative particle [अ अनन्त, O Viṣṇu], T.

3. अ (before a vowel अन्, exc. अ-ऋणिन्), a prefix corresponding to Gk. ἀ, ἀν, Lat. in, Goth. and Germ. un, Eng. in or un, and having a negative or privative or contrary sense (अन्-एक not one; अन्-अन्त endless; अ-सत् not good; अ-पश्यत् not seeing)

rarely prefixed to Inf. (अ-स्वप्तुम् not to sleep, TāṇḍyaBr.) and even to forms of the finite verb (अ-स्पृहयन्ति they do not desire, BhP.; Śiś.) and to pronouns (अ-सः not he, Śiś.; अ-तद् not that, BhP.)
occasionally denoting comparison (अ-ब्राह्मण like a Brahman, T.)

rarely an expletive (cf. अ-कुप्य, अ-पूप). According to Pāṇ. vi, 2, 161, the accent may be optionally either on the first or last syllable in certain compounds formed with अ (as अ/-तीक्ष्ण or अ-तीक्ष्ण/, अ/-शुचि or अ-शुचि/, अ/न्-अन्न or अन्-अन्न/)
the same applies to stems ending in तृ accentuated on the first syllable before अ is prefixed
cf. also अ/-तूर्त and अ-तू/र्त, अ/-भिन्न and अ-भिन्न/, &c.
4. अ the base of some pronouns and pronom. forms, in अस्य, अत्र, &c.

5. अ the augment prefixed to the root in the formation of the imperfect, aorist, and conditional tenses (in the Veda often wanting, as in Homer, the fact being that originally the augment was only prefixed in principal sentences where it was accentuated, whilst it was dropped in subordinate sentences where the root-vowel took the accent).
6. अ m. N. of Viṣṇu, L. (especially as the first of the three sounds in the sacred syllable ओम्).
aTA: अ/थ or अ/था (or Ved. अ/था), ind. (probably fr. pronom. base अ) an auspicious and inceptive particle (not easily expressed in English), now; then; moreover; rather; certainly; but; else; what? how else? &c.
manam: 1. मन m. Indian spikenard, Nardostachys Jatamansi, L.
N. of a son of Śambara, Hariv. (v.l. मत).
3. मन/ m. du. (for 1. and 2. See p. 783, col. 2) a partic. ornament, RV. viii, 78, 2.
rAm: रा (आ), f. (only L.) amorous play (= विभ्रम)

1. रा or रास् cl. 2. P. (Dhātup. xxiv, 49) रा/ति (Ved. also Ā. राते/; Impv. रिरीहि, ररास्व, ररीध्वम्; p. रराण; 3. sg. र/रते and रासते; pf. ररिम/, ररे/; aor. अ/रास्म Subj. रा/सत् &c. Pot. रासीय; Class. forms are only pr. राति; fut. राता, BhP.; रास्यति, Vop., and inf. रातवे, BhP.), to grant, give, bestow, impart, yield, surrender, RV.; &c.
kaMsa: कंस/ अस्, अम्, m. n. (√ कम्, Uṇ. iii, 62), a vessel made of metal, drinking vessel, cup, goblet, AV. x, 10, 5; AitBr.; ŚBr. &c.
(a noun ending in अस् followed by कंस in a compound does not change its final, cf. अयस्-कंस, &c., Pāṇ. viii, 3, 46)
a particular measure (= two Āḍhakas, Car.; = one Āḍhaka, L.)
a metal, tutanag or white copper, brass, bell-metal

कंस/ (अस्), m. N. of a king of Mathurā (son of Ugra-sena and cousin of the Devakī who was mother of Kṛṣṇa [Ugra-sena being brother of Devaka, who was father of Devakī]; he is usually called the uncle, but was really a cousin of Kṛṣṇa, and became his implacable enemy because it had been prophesied to Kaṃsa that he would be killed by a child of Devakī; as the foe of the deity he is identified with the Asura Kālanemi; and, as he was ultimately slain by Kṛṣṇa, the latter receives epithets like कंस-जित्, conqueror of Kaṃsa, &c.), MBh.; VP.; BhP. &c.
N. of a place g. तक्षशिलादि, Pāṇ. iv, 3, 93
mAntra: मान्त्र mf(ई)n. (fr. मन्त्र) proper or peculiar to Vedic or magical texts, MW.
mAsa: मा/स m. (or n., Siddh.) the moon (see पूर्ण-म्°)

a month or the 12th part of the Hindū year (there are 4 kinds of months, viz. the solar, सौर; the natural, सावन; the stellar, नाक्षत्र, and the lunar, चान्द्र; the latter, which is the most usual and consists of 30 Tithis, being itself of two kinds as reckoned from the new or full moon, cf. IW. 179; for the names of the months see ib. 173 n. 3), RV. &c. &c. (मासम्, for a month; मासम् एकम्, for one month; मासेन, in the course of a month; मासे, in a m° = after the lapse of a m°)
a symbolical N. for the number ‘twelve’, Sūryas.
laM: 1. ल the 3rd semivowel (corresponding to the vowels ऌ, ॡ, and having the sound of the English l)

a technical term for all the tenses and moods of a finite verb or for the terminations of those tenses and moods (also applied to some forms with कृत् affixes construed like a finite verb, Pāṇ. ii, 3, 69; cf. iii, 2, 124, and when accompanied by certain indicatory letters denoting each tense separately See लट्; लङ्; लिङ्; लोट्; लिट्; लुट्; ऌट्; लुङ्; ऌङ्; लेट्), Pāṇ. iii, 4, 69; 77, Sch.
2. ल m. N. of Indra, L.
3. ल (in prosody) = लघु, a short syllable.
sadasya: सदस्य^ m. ‘present in the sacrificial enclosure’, an assessor, spectator, member of an assembly (at a sacrifice), a superintending priest, the seventeenth priest (whose duties accord. to the Kuṣītakins, are merely to look on and correct mistakes), TS.; Br.; GṛŚrS.; MBh.; BhP.
a person belonging to a learned court-circle, Jātakam.
Anata: आ-नत &c. See under आ-√ नम् next page.
आ/-नत mfn. bending, stooping, bowed, Ragh.; Kathās.
bent or curved inwards (as a bow), ŚBr.
Daram: धर mf(आ)n. (√ धृ) bearing, supporting (scil. the world, said of Kṛṣṇa and Śiva), MBh.
ifc. holding, bearing, carrying, wearing, possessing, having, keeping (also in memory), sustaining, preserving, observing (cf. अंशु-, अक्ष-, कुलं- &c.), MBh.; R. &c.
धर m. a mountain, Kir. xv, 12 (cf. क्षिति-, भू- &c.)
a frivolous or dissolute man (= विट), L.
of a follower of the Pāṇḍavas, ib. of the king of the tortoises, L.
of the father of Padma-prabha (6th Arhat of pres. Ava-sarpiṇī), L.
mahA: महा/ in comp. for महत् (in RV. ii, 22, 1 and iii, 23; 49, 1 used for महत् as an independent word in acc. sg. महा/म् = महान्तम्).
rAta: रात/ mfn. given, presented, bestowed, RV. &c. &c. (often ifc.; cf. अस्मद्-, देव-, ब्रह्म-र्°. &c.)
रात/ m. N. of a teacher, Piṅg., Sch.
vARija: वाणिज/ m. (also written बाणिज/; fr. वणिज्) a merchant, trader, TBr.; MBh. (cf. Pāṇ. vi, 2, 13) the submarine fire (supposed to be at the south-pole), L.
yamI: यमी/ (ई/), f. N. of Yama's twin-sister (who is identified in Post-vedic mythology with the river-goddess Yamunā), RV. &c. &c.
aSma[n]: 1. अश्मन् m. an eater, AV. xviii, 4, 54.
2. अ/श्मन् m. (once अश्म/न्, ŚBr. iii), a stone, rock, RV. &c.
a precious stone, RV. v, 47, 3; ŚBr. vi
any instrument made of stone (as a hammer &c.), RV. &c.
अश्मन् [cf. Zd. asman; Pers. aṣmān; Lith. akmů; Slav. kamy].
mayas: म/यस् n. (prob. fr. √ 3. मा) refreshment, enjoyment, pleasure, delight, RV.; VS.; TBr.
maTana: मथन mf(ई, once आ)n. rubbing, stirring, shaking, harassing, destroying (with gen. or ifc.), MBh.; R. &c.
मथन m. Premna Spinosa (the wood of which is used to produce fire by attrition), L.
मथन n. the act of rubbing, friction, BhP.
stirring or whirling round, churning or producing by churning, MBh.; R.; Pur.
hurting, annoying, injury, destruction, R.; Ratnāv.
vaDam: वध/ m. one who kills, a slayer, vanquisher, destroyer, RV.; VS.; TS.; ŚBr.
a deadly weapon (esp. Indra's thunderbolt), RV.; AitBr.; ŚāṅkhGṛ.
the act of striking or killing, slaughter, murder, death, destruction, RV. &c. &c.
(in law) capital or (more commonly) corporal punishment, Mn.; Yājñ. &c. = वध-भूमि, place of execution, Caurap., Introd.
annihilation, disappearance (of inanimate things), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
a defect, imperfection (28 are enumerated), VP.
aSvada: अश्व—द mfn. giving horses, Mn. iv, 231.
Bawa: भट m. (fr. भृत) a mercenary, hired soldier, warrior, combatant, MBh.; Kāv. &c.
pl. N. of a degraded tribe, L. (cf. भट्ट, भड, भण्ड; according to some ‘a person whose father is a Brāhman and whose mother is a Naṭī’)
Amaya: आमय m. sickness, disease, ŚBr.; KātyŚr.; Yājñ.; R. &c.
आमय n. the medicinal plant Costus Speciosus, Bhpr.
dan: (accord. to some fr. √ दंस्, ‘to make straight’, either ‘to raise, erect’, or ‘to put right, rule, guide, manage’; in some places probably = ‘a guide, manager, institutor’).
adamBa: अ-दम्भ mfn. free from deceit, straightforward
atana: अतन m. a passer on Nir.
अतन n. act of passing on Nir.
Cinna: छिन्न/ mfn. cut off, cut, divided, torn, cut through, perforated, AV. &c.
interrupted, not contiguous, Bhag. vi, 36; R. iii, 50, 12; VarBṛS.
disturbed (किं नश् छिन्नम्, ‘what is there in this to disturb us?’ there is nothing to care about, Amar.), Hariv. 16258; Mṛcch.
? (said of the belly of a leach), Suśr.
taken away or out of R. ii, 56, 23; Ragh. xii, 80
ifc. decaying or exhausted by, Buddh.; L.
Atma: आत्म (in comp. for आत्म/न्; also rarely ifc., e.g. अध्य्-आत्म, अध्य्-आत्म/म्).
kavya: 1. कव्य/ mfn. (= कवि, Kāś. on Pāṇ. v, 4, 30) wise, RV. x, 15, 9 (at, VS. xxii, 2 read कव्या/ः)
a sacrificer, sacrificial priest, RV. ix, 91, 2
N. of a class of deities associated with Aṅgiras and Ṛkvan [Gmn.; a class of manes], RV. x, 14, 3; AV.
N. of one of the seven sages of the fourth Manv-antara, Hariv.
(अम्), n. (generally in connection with हव्य See हव्य-कव्य) ‘what must be offered to the wise’, an oblation of food to deceased ancestors, MBh.; Mn.
2. कव्य Nom. P. कव्यति, to be wise, Pāṇ. vii, 4, 39.
rAsAya: 1. रा or रास् cl. 2. P. (Dhātup. xxiv, 49) रा/ति (Ved. also Ā. राते/; Impv. रिरीहि, ररास्व, ररीध्वम्; p. रराण; 3. sg. र/रते and रासते; pf. ररिम/, ररे/; aor. अ/रास्म Subj. रा/सत् &c. Pot. रासीय; Class. forms are only pr. राति; fut. राता, BhP.; रास्यति, Vop., and inf. रातवे, BhP.), to grant, give, bestow, impart, yield, surrender, RV.; &c.

1. रास् (cf. √ 1. रस्) cl. 1. Ā. (Dhātup. xvi, 25) रासते (pf. ररासे, Kāv.; fut. रासिता, रासिष्यते Gr.; aor. अरासिष्ट, ib.), to howl, cry, MBh.; R. &c.: Intens. रारास्यते, to cry aloud, utter loud lamentations (only p. रारास्यमान; B. वावाश्यमान), MBh.
sahanam: सहन mf(आ)n. powerful, strong (in explanation of the etymology of सिंह), Nir. viii, 15
सहन n. patient endurance, forbearance, MārkP.; Sāh.
trARa[m]: त्राण n. protecting, preserving, protection, defence, shelter, help (often ifc.), ChUp.; Mn.; MBh. &c.
protection for the body, armour, helmet &c., iii, 12092
caram: चर mfn. (g. पचादि) moving, locomotive (as animals opposed to plants, or as the Karaṇas in astrol.), VPrāt.; ŚvetUp. iii, 18; Mn. vii, 15; MBh. &c.
(= संचारिन्) forming the retinue of any one, BhP. iv, 29, 23
ifc. going, walking, wandering, being, living, practising (e.g. अधश्-, अन्त-, अन्तरिक्ष-, अप्-, आदाय-, उदके-, &c.; cf. Pāṇ. iii, 2, 16)

चर mf(ई)n. ifc. (Pāṇ. v, 3, 53 f.; vi, 3, 35 f.) having been formerly (e.g. आढ्य-, देवदत्त-, qq.vv.; अ-दृष्ट- or नदृष्ट-, ‘not seen before’, Kathās. [once f. irr. आ, lx, 58] Sarvad. iii, 16; vii, 19; अन्-आलोकित- id., Bālar. iv, 54/55)
चर m. a spy, secret emissary or agent, Mn. vii, 122; Hariv. 10316; R. &c.
the small shell Cypraea moneta, L.
a game played with dice (similar to backgammon), L.
चर n. (in astron.) ascensional difference, Gol. vii
(in astron., read, ‘the difference of time between the rising of a heavenly body at Laṅkā or Ceylon, over which the first meridian passes, and that of its rising at any partic. place’).
tadannam: त/द्—अन्न (त/द्-), mfn. accustomed to that food, RV. viii, 47, 16
eating (that i.e.) the same food, R. ii, 103, 30 and 140, 13.
raRAya: 1. रण् or रन् (cf. √ रम्) cl. 1. 4. P. र/णति, र/ण्यति (2. du. रण्य/थः, RV. i, 112, 18; pf. रारण or ररण, RV.; aor. अराणिषुः, रणिष्टन, ib.), to rejoice, be pleased, take pleasure in (loc., rarely acc.), RV.; to gladden, delight, gratify, ib. : Caus. रणयति, °ते, to cheer, gladden, exhilarate with (instr. or loc.), RV.; to be at ease, be pleased or satisfied with, delight in (loc.), ib.; TS.; AV. : Intens. (Subj. रार/णत्, रार/न्; Impv. रारन्धि, रारन्तु) = Caus. (as well in the trans. as in the intrans. meanings), RV.

2. रण् cl. 1. P. (Dhātup. xiii, 2) रणति (Gr. also pf. रराण fut. रणिता &c.), to sound, ring, rattle, jingle, Kāv.; Pur. : Caus. रणयति (aor. अरीरणत् or अरराणत्, Pat. on Pāṇ. vii, 4, 3), to make resound, BhP. : Desid. रिरणिषति Gr.: Intens. रंरण्यते, रंरण्टि, ib.
3. रण् cl. 10. P. रणयति, to go, Dhātup. xix, 33; 56.
macCam: मच्छ m. (Prākṛ. for मत्स्य) a fish, L.
SaraRa[m]: 1. शरण m. (for 2. See p. 1057, col. 1) one of the arrows of Kāma-deva, Cat.
शरण n. falling asunder, bursting, falling in Vop.
2. शरण/ mfn. (fr. √ शृ for श्रि; for 1. See p. 1056) protecting, guarding, defending, RV.; AV.
शरण/ m. N. of a serpent-demon, MBh.
शरण/ f(आ and ई). N. of various plants &c. (prob. w.r. for सरणा, °णी, q.v.)
शरण/ n. (ifc. f(आ). ), shelter, place of shelter or refuge or rest, hut, house, habitation, abode, lair (of an animal), home, asylum, RV. &c. &c.
शरण/ n. refuge, protection, refuge with (शरणं √ गम् or या or इ &c., ‘to go to any one for protection, seek refuge with’ [acc. or gen.]; often ifc.), Mn.; MBh. &c.
(with इन्द्रस्य) N. of a Sāman, ĀrṣBr. 2.
rantya: र/न्त्य mfn. (√ रम् ?) pleasant, comfortable, RV.; AV.
ramam: रम mfn. pleasing, delighting, rejoicing (only ifc.; cf. मनो-र्°)
AvaraRa: आ-वरण mfn. covering, hiding, concealing, Ragh.
आ-वरण n. the act of covering, concealing, hiding, Suśr.; Ragh.
an obstruction, interruption, Mn.; Suśr.; Ragh.
a covering, garment, cloth, MBh.; Kir.; Śak.; Ragh.
anything that protects, an outer bar or fence

2. सह/ ind. (prob. fr. 7. स + धा, which in Veda may become ध; cf. 1. सध) together with, along with, with (with √ ग्रह् and आ-√ दा, ‘to take with one’; with √ दा, ‘to give to take away with one’; with कृत्वा and acc., ‘taking with one’, ‘in the company of’; often as a prepos. governing instr. case, but generally placed after the governed word, e.g. तेन सह, ‘along with him’ ; exceptionally with abl., e.g. ऐश्वर्यात् सह, ‘with sovereignty’, Cāṇ. 104)

in common, in company, jointly, conjointly, in concert (often used as a prefix in comp., expressing ‘community of action’, e.g. सहाध्ययन, q.v.; or forming adjectives expressing ‘the companion of an action’, e.g. सह-चर, q.v.)
at the same time or simultaneously with (prefixed to adverbs of time, e.g. सह-पूर्वाह्णम्, q.v.; rarely ifc., e.g. वैनतेय-स्°, ‘with Vainateya’, Hariv.), RV. &c. &c.

Bhaṭṭ.; fut. भास्य/ति, Br. &c.), to shine, be bright or luminous, RV. &c. &c.; to shine forth, appear, show one's self, ib.; to be splendid or beautiful or eminent, MBh.; Kāv. &c. (with न, to cut a poor figure, Kathās.); to appear as, seem, look like, pass for (nom. with or without इव adv. in वत्), MBh.; Kāv. &c.; to be, exist, W.; to show, exhibit, manifest, Bhaṭṭ. (v.l.) : Pass. भायते, impers. radiance is put forth by (instr.), Bhaṭṭ. : Caus. भापयते; aor. अबीभपत् Gr.: Desid. बिभासति, ib. : Intens. बाभायते, बाभेति, बाभाति, ib.
भा [cf. √ भन्, भाष्, भास्; Gk. ϕημί, ϕάσκω; Lat. fāri &c.; Germ. Bann; Eng. ban.]

unnam: उन्-√ नम् (उद्-√ नम्) P. -नमति, to bend upwards, raise one's self, rise, ascend, Prab.; Mṛcch.; Pañcat.; Bhartṛ. &c.; to raise up, lift up, Pañcat. : Caus. -नमयति, or -नामयति, to bend upwards, raise, erect, elevate, MBh.; R.; Śak.; Kathās. &c.
AsTAm: 1. आ-√ स्था P. Ā. -तिष्ठति, -ते, to stand or remain on or by; to ascend, mount; to stay near, go towards, resort to, RV.; AV.; ŚBr.; ĀśvGṛ.; MBh.; R.; BhP.; Kum. &c.; to act according to, follow, R.; BhP.; to undertake, perform, do, carry out, practise, use, MBh.; R.; Hariv.; BhP.; Kathās. &c.; to side or take part with, be of the opinion of; to maintain, affirm, Pat.; to acknowledge; to take care for, have regard for, MBh.; Sarvad. &c.: Caus. -स्थापयति, to cause to ascend, Kauś.; to cause to stay or stop; to arrest, stop, RV.; Kauś.; to fix into, put into, AitBr.; BhP.; Kathās.; to hurt, RV.; to constipate; to strengthen, Suśr.; to introduce, Sāh.
2. आ-स्था f. consideration, regard, care, care for (with loc., e.g. मय्य् आस्था, care for me), Hit.; Ragh.; Kathās. &c.
place or means of abiding, L.

violence, force, rapine, rape, robbery, felony, aggression, cruelty, Gaut.; Āpast.; Nār.

a vehicle of any kind, carriage, waggon, vessel, ship, litter, palanquin, RV. &c. &c.

(with Buddhists) the vehicle or method of arriving at knowledge, the means of release from repeated births (there are either 3 systems, the श्रावक-यान, the प्रत्येक-बुद्ध-य्° or प्रत्येक-य्°, and the महा-य्°; or more generally only 2, the महा-यान or ‘Great method’ and the हिन-य्° or ‘Lesser method’; sometimes there is only ‘One Vehicle’, the एक-यान, or ‘one way to beatitude’), SaddhP.; Dharmas. 2 (cf. MWB. 159 &c.)

fine, soft, tender (as a skin), BhP. iii, 31, 27

of a son of Ghṛta-pṛṣṭha, BhP. v, 20, 21

grain not yet freed from chaff
