mIra: मीर m. the sea, ocean, Uṇ. ii, 25, Sch. (L. also ‘a partic. part of a mountain; a limit, boundary; a drink, beverage’).
raTya: र/थ्य mfn. (or रथ्य^) belonging or relating to a carriage or chariot, accustomed to it &c. (with आजि/, ‘a chariot-race’), RV.; ŚBr.
(?) delighting in roads (see f. and रथ्य-विरथ्य)
र/थ्य m. a carriage or chariot-horse, RV.; Śak.
र/थ्य n. carriage equipments (trappings, a wheel &c.), RV.; Lāṭy.
tAmra: ताम्र/ mf(आ)n. (√ तम्, Uṇ.) of a coppery red colour, VS. xvi (Naigh. iii, 7), MBh. &c. (ताम्रा त्वच्, the 4th of the 7 membranes with which an embryo is covered, Suśr. iii, 4, 2)
ताम्र/ mf(ई)n. made of copper, R. iii, 21, 17; Suśr.; Mn. vi, 53/54; BhavP.
ताम्र/ m. a kind of leprosy with large red spots, Karmavip.
N. of a son of Naraka Bhauma, BhP. x, 59, 12
sava: 1. सव/ m. (fr. √ 3. सु) pressing out the juice of the Soma plant, RV.; ŚBr.; ŚāṅkhŚr.
सव/ n. the juice or honey of flowers, L.
2. सव/ m. (fr. √ 1. सू) one who sets in motion or impels, an instigator, stimulator, commander, VS.; ŚBr.
सव/ m. the sun (cf. सवितृ), L.
setting in motion, vivification, instigation, impulse, command, order (esp. applied to the activity of Savitṛ; dat. सवा/य, ‘for setting in motion’), RV.; AV.; VS.; TBr.
N. of partic. initiatory rites, inauguration, consecration, Br.
3. सव m. (fr. √ 2. सू) offspring, progeny, L.
Aharam: 1. आ-हर mfn. ifc. bringing, fetching, Ragh.
2. आ-हर (2. sg. Impv. forming irregular Tatpuruṣa compounds with the following words) :
ut: उत् ind. a particle of doubt or deliberation (= 2. उत, q.v.), L.
sAman: 1. सा/मन् n. (fr. √ 1. सा = 1. सन्) acquisition, possession, property, wealth, abundance, RV.; VS.

2. सा/मन् n. (m. only in TBr.; prob. connected with √ सान्त्व्; accord. to some fr. √ 1. सा; cf. 3. सामन्) calming, tranquillizing, (esp.) kind or gentle words for winning an adversary, conciliation, negotiation (one of the 4 Upāyas or means of success against an enemy, the other 3 being दान, भेद, and दण्ड, qq.vv.; ibc. or instr. sg. and pl., ‘by friendly means or in a friendly way, willingly, voluntarily’), TBr.; &c.

3. सा/मन् n. (of doubtful derivation; accord. to Uṇ. iv, 152 fr. √ सो = 2. सा, as ‘destroying sin’; in Nir. vii, 12 apparently connected with सम्मित; by others derived fr. √ 1. सन्, सा, सान्त्व्, and perhaps not to be separated fr. 1. and 2. सामन्) a metrical hymn or song of praise, (esp.) a partic. kind of sacred text or verse called a Sāman (intended to be chanted, and forming, with ऋच्, यजुस्, छन्दस्, one of the 4 kinds of Vedic composition mentioned first in RV. x, 90, 9), RV. &c. &c.
any song or tune (sacred or profane, also the hum of bees), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
the faculty of uttering sounds (?), TBr. (Sch.)
Aravam: आरब or आरव, m. an Arabian (f(ई).), Jain.
आ-रव m. (Pāṇ. iii, 3, 50) cry, crying, howling
carI: चरी (ई), f. a young woman (cf. चरटि), L.
also ifc. See अनु- and सहचरी.
SAsaM: N. of the hymn x, 152, AitBr.
of its author (having the patr. Bhāradvāja), Anukr.
2. शास/ m. (for 1. See p. 1068, col. 3) a butcher's knife, Br.; ŚrS.
udDana: उद्-धन m. (√ हन्) a wooden swordlike instrument for stirring boiled rice, L.
raDra: रध्र/ mfn. willing, pliant, obedient, RV. (others ‘weary’ or ‘wealthy’ or ‘a miser’ or ‘officious’ or ‘active’ &c.)
Cinna[m]: छिन्न/ mfn. cut off, cut, divided, torn, cut through, perforated, AV. &c.
interrupted, not contiguous, Bhag. vi, 36; R. iii, 50, 12; VarBṛS.
disturbed (किं नश् छिन्नम्, ‘what is there in this to disturb us?’ there is nothing to care about, Amar.), Hariv. 16258; Mṛcch.
? (said of the belly of a leach), Suśr.
taken away or out of R. ii, 56, 23; Ragh. xii, 80
ifc. decaying or exhausted by, Buddh.; L.
sarva: स/र्व mf(आ)n. (perhaps connected with सार, q.v.; inflected as a pronoun except nom. acc. sg. n. सर्वम्, and serving as a model for a series of pronominals, cf. सर्व-नामन्) whole, entire, all, every (m. sg. ‘every one’; pl. ‘all’; n. sg. ‘everything’; sometimes strengthened by विश्व [which if alone in RV. appears in the meaning ‘all’, ‘every’, ‘every one’] and निखिल; सर्वेऽपि, ‘all together’; सर्वः कोऽपि, ‘every one so ever’; गवां सर्वम्, ‘all that comes from cows’; सर्व with a negation = ‘not any’, ‘no’, ‘none’ or ‘not every one’, ‘not everything’), RV. &c. &c.
of all sorts, manifold, various, different, MBh. &c.
(with another adjective or in comp.; cf. below) altogether, wholly, completely, in all parts, everywhere, RV.; ChUp. &c.
स/र्व m. (declined like a subst.) N. of Śiva, MBh.
pl. N. of a people, MārkP.
सर्व [cf. Gk. ὅλος for ὁλϝος Lat. salvus.]
kaSa: क/श m. a species of rodent animal, VS.; TS. (cf. कशीका/)
क/श m. pl. N. of a people, BhP. (ed. Bomb.)
avatAna: अव-तान/ m. ‘unbending of a bow’, N. of the verses, VS. xiv, 54-63; ŚBr.
a cover (spread over climbing plants), MBh. ii, 355; R. v, 16, 28
N. of a man, Pāṇ. ii, 4, 67, Kāś.
mAnana: मानन mfn. (fr. Caus.) honouring, serving as a token of respect, Nir.
मानन n. and f(आ). paying honour, showing respect, MBh.; Kāv. &c.
sarA(m): सरा/ (आ/), f. moving or wandering about, Gal.
sampanna[m]: सम्-पन्न mfn. fallen or turned out well, accomplished, effected, perfect, excellent (ifc. or with loc. = ‘perfectly acquainted or conversant with’), AV. &c. &c.
of perfect or correct flavour, palatable, dainty, ĀśvGṛ.; MBh.; R.
endowed or furnished with, possessed of (instr. adv. in -तस्, or comp. also with transposition of the members; cf. below), ŚBr.; MBh. &c.
सम्-पन्न m. N. of Śiva, MBh.
सम्-पन्न (अम्), n. dainty food, a delicacy, MBh. xiii, 4567
Ahita[m]: आ/-हित mfn. placed on, placed, deposited, put on Pāṇ. viii, 4, 8; RV.; AV.; MBh. &c.
deposited, pledged, pawned Comm. on Yājñ. &c.
आ-हित n. a partic. mode of fighting (v.l. अ-ह्°), Hariv.
आ-हित and आ-हिति. See आ-√ धा.
vawa: वट m. (perhaps Prākṛt for वृत, ‘surrounded, covered’; cf. न्यग्-रोध) the Banyan or Indian fig tree (Ficus Indica), MBh.; Kāv. &c., RTL. 337 (also said to be n.)
a small shell, the Cypraea Moneta or cowry, L.
of one of Skanda's attendants, MBh.
the son of a Vaiśya and a Venukī, L. (also n. and f(ई). )
a string, rope, tie, L. (only वट ibc., and पञ्च-व्°, q.v.)
a small lump, globule &c. = वटक, ŚārṅgS.
SAmana: शामन mfn. extinguishing, destroying, Pañcat. iii, 31 (v.l. for शमन)
शामन m. N. of Yama (= शमन), W.
end (°नं-√ या, to go to an end, be destroyed), MW.
veDana: वेधन n. piercing, hitting (with an arrow), MBh.
Bava: भव/ m. (√ भू) coming into existence, birth, production, origin (= भाव, Vop.; ifc., with f(आ). = arising or produced from, being in, relating to), Yājñ.; MBh.; Kāv. &c.
being, state of being, existence, life (= सत्-ता, L.), ŚārṅgP. (cf. भवान्तर)
worldly existence, the world (= संसार, L.), Kāv.; Pur.
(with Buddhists) continuity of becoming (a link in the twelvefold chain of causation), Dharmas. 42 (MWB. 102)
well-being, prosperity, welfare, excellence (= श्रेयस्, L.), MBh.; Kāv. &c.

of a deity attending on Rudra and frequently connected with Śarva (later N. of Śiva or a form of Śiva; or N. of a Rudra, and as such of the number 11 or of the 11th lunar mansion, Gol.; Var., Sch.; du. भवौ = Bhava i.e. Śiva and his wife Bhavānī, BhP.; cf. Vām. v, 2, 1), AV. &c. &c.
of a son of Pratihartṛ, VP.
भव/ n. the fruit of Dillenia Speciosa, L.
yata: यत/ mfn. restrained, held in, held forth, kept down or limited, subdued, governed, controlled &c., RV. &c. &c. (cf. comp. below)
the spurring or guiding of an elephant by means of the rider's feet, L.
mAnasam: मानस/ mf(ई, once आ)n. (fr. म/नस्) belonging to the mind or spirit, mental, spiritual (opp. to शारीर, corporeal), VS. &c. &c.
expressed only in the mind, performed in thought i.e. silent, tacit (as a hymn or prayer), ŚrS.; Mn.; MBh.
conceived or present in the mind, conceivable, imaginable, R.
relating to or dwelling on the lake Mānasa (see n. below), BhP.
मानस/ m. a form of Viṣṇu, VP.
of a son of Vapuṣ-mat, MārkP.
मानस/ m. pl. a partic. class of deceased ancestors (regarded as sons of Vasiṣṭha), Cat.
N. of the Vaiśyas in Śākadvīpa, MBh.
of the worlds of the Soma-pa, Hariv.
मानस/ n. (ifc. f(आ). ) the mental powers, mind, spirit, heart, soul (= मनस्, g. प्रज्ञादि), KaṭhUp.; MBh.; Kāv. &c.
मानस/ n. (in law) tacit or implied consent, W.
a kind of salt, KātyŚr., Sch.
the 25th mansion from that under which one is born, VarYogay.

(with or scil. सरस्, or तीर्थ) N. of a sacred lake and place of pilgrimage on mount Kailāsa (the native place of the wild geese, which migrate to it every year at the breeding season), MBh.; Kāv.; Pur.
N. of wk. on Śilpa or art.
jani: ज/नि, °नी, f. a woman, wife (gen. °न्युर्, RV. x, 10, 3), RV. (pl. also fig. ‘the fingers’), VS.
birth, production, Sarvad.; KapS. i, 97, Sch.
a kind of fragrant plant, L.
the root जन्, Bādar. iii, 1, 24, Sch.
Arasa: आ-रस m. a scream, shout, Mālav.
ahi: अ/हि m. (√ अंह्), a snake, RV. &c.
the serpent of the sky, the demon Vṛtra, RV.
N. of a Ṛṣi (with the patron. औशनस) and of another (with the patron. पैद्व).
अहि [Zd. aži; Lat. angui-s; Gk. ἔχι-ς, ἔχιδνα, ἔγχελυς, and ὄϕις; Lith. ungury-s; Russ. ûgorj; Armen. ôz; Germ. unc.]
manman: म/न्मन् n. thought, understanding, intellect, wisdom, RV.
expression of thought i.e. hymn, prayer, petition, ib.
sadAra: स—दार mfn. accompanied by a wife, ĀpŚr.; Ragh.
caya: चय m. (iii, 3, 56, Kāś.; g. वृषादि) a mound of earth (raised to form the foundation of a building or raised as a rampart), MBh. iii, 11699; Hariv.; R.; Pañcat.
a heap, pile, collection, multitude, assemblage, MBh.; Hariv. &c.
(in med.) accumulation of the humors (cf. सं-), Suśr.
the amount by which each term increases, common increase or difference of the terms, Bījag. (cf. अग्नि-).
varRam: व/र्ण m. (or n. g. अर्धर्चादि, prob. fr. √ 1. वृ; ifc. f(आ). ) a covering, cloak, mantle, L.
a cover, lid, Yājñ. iii, 99
outward appearance, exterior, form, figure, shape, colour, RV. &c. &c.
colour of the face, (esp.) good colour or complexion, lustre, beauty, Mn.; MBh. &c.
colour, tint, dye, pigment (for painting or writing), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
colour = race, species, kind, sort, character, nature, quality, property (applied to persons and things), RV. &c. &c.

class of men, tribe, order, caste (prob. from contrast of colour between the dark aboriginal tribes and their fair conquerors; in RV. esp. applied to the Āryas and the Dāsas; but more properly applicable to the four principal classes described in Manu's code, viz. Brāhmans, Kṣatriyas, Vaiśyas, and Śūdras; the more modern word for ‘caste’ being jāti; cf. IW. 210 n. 1), ib.
a letter, sound, vowel, syllable, word, Br.; Prāt. &c.
a musical sound or note (also applied to the voice of animals), MBh.; R.; Pañcat.
the order or arrangement of a song or poem, W.
praise, commendation, renown, glory, Mṛcch.; Kum.; Rājat.
(in alg.) an unknown magnitude or quantity
(in arithm.) the figure, ‘one’
(accord. to some) a co-efficient
a kind of measure, L. (cf. -ताल)
gold, L.
a religious observance, L.
one who wards off, expeller, Sāy. on RV. i, 104, 2
व/र्ण n. saffron, L.
वर्ण [Cf., accord. to some, Slav. vranǔ, ‘black’, ‘a crow’; Lith. várnas, ‘a crow’.]
ucca: उच्च mfn. (said to be fr. च fr. √ अञ्च् with 1. उद्), high, lofty, elevated
pronounced with the Udātta accent, RPrāt.; VPrāt. &c.
the apex of the orbit of a planet, Kālas, R. &c.
उच्च [cf. Hib. uchdan, ‘a hillock’; Cambro-Brit. uched, ‘cleve’.]
anuvAda: अनु-वाद m. saying after or again, repeating by way of explanation, explanatory repetition or reiteration with corroboration or illustration, explanatory reference to anything already said
a passage of the Brāhmaṇas which explains or illustrates a rule (विधि) previously propounded (such a passage is sometimes called अनुवाद-वचन)
tatara: त—तर mfn. (compar.) that one (of two), Pāṇ. v, 3, 92.
tanam: त/न n. offspring, posterity, i, 39, 7; viii, 18, 18 and 25, 2; AV. vii, 73, 5 (°ना/या for °नाय)
Amra: आम्र/ m. the mango tree, Mangifera Indica, MBh.; R.; Śak. &c.
आम्र/ n. the fruit of the mango tree, Suśr.; ŚBr.; &c;
dAhana: दाहन n. (fr. the Caus.) causing to burn or be burnt, reducing to ashes, MBh. i, 403; BhP. xii, 12, 40
vyaya: व्यय mfn. (or व्य्-अय, fr. 3. वि + √ 5. इ) passing away, mutable, liable to change or decay (only as opp. to or connected with अ-व्यय), Mn.; MBh.; Pur.
व्यय m. (ifc. f(आ). ) disappearance, decay, ruin, loss, MBh.; Kāv. &c.

व्यय m. spending, expense, outlay, disbursement (opp. to आय, ‘income’, and often with कोशस्य, वित्तस्य, धनस्य &c.; without a gen. = ‘extravagance, waste, prodigality’; with loc. or ifc. = ‘outlay for or in’), Mn.; MBh. &c.
cost, sacrifice of (gen. or comp.; व्ययेन ifc. = ‘at the cost of’), R.; Kālid.
N. of the 20th (or 54th) year of Jupiter's cycle, VarBṛS. of a serpent-demon, MBh.
SaSI: शशी f. N. of an Apsaras, Kāraṇḍ.
rIra: रीर m. N. of Śiva, Cat.
talam: तल (m., L.) n. (√ स्तृ) surface, level, flat roof (of a house), MBh. &c. (chiefly ifc. [f(आ). , R. v, 13] cf. नभस्-, मही- &c.)
the part underneath, lower part, base, bottom, Mn. ii, 59; VarBṛS.; Pañcat. &c. (cf. अधस्-, तरु- &c.)
तल m. n. the palm (of the hand See कर-, पाणि-), R. ii, 104, 17; Śak.; Ragh. vi, 18
the sole (of the foot, अङ्घ्रि-, पाद-), MBh. i; VarBṛS.
(without कर- &c.) the palm of the hand (अन्यो ऽन्यस्य, or परस्परं तलं or °लान्-√ दा, to slap each other with the palms of the hands), MBh.; Hariv.; R.; Suśr.
तल m. n., L. the sole of the foot, R. v, 13, 47
= ताल (a span, L.; the handle of a sword, L.; the palmyra tree, Viddh. ii, 13)
pressing the strings of a lute with the left hand, MBh. viii
N. of a hell, ĀruṇUp.; ŚivaP. (cf. तलातल)
N. of a teacher g. शौनकादि
the root or seed of events, L.
aSana: 1. अशन mfn. reaching, reaching across, Nir.
food, ŚBr. &c. (often ifc., e.g. मूल-फलाशन mf(आ)n. having roots and fruit for food, Mn. &c.)
varRa[m]: व/र्ण m. (or n. g. अर्धर्चादि, prob. fr. √ 1. वृ; ifc. f(आ). ) a covering, cloak, mantle, L.
a cover, lid, Yājñ. iii, 99
outward appearance, exterior, form, figure, shape, colour, RV. &c. &c.
colour of the face, (esp.) good colour or complexion, lustre, beauty, Mn.; MBh. &c.
colour, tint, dye, pigment (for painting or writing), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
colour = race, species, kind, sort, character, nature, quality, property (applied to persons and things), RV. &c. &c.

class of men, tribe, order, caste (prob. from contrast of colour between the dark aboriginal tribes and their fair conquerors; in RV. esp. applied to the Āryas and the Dāsas; but more properly applicable to the four principal classes described in Manu's code, viz. Brāhmans, Kṣatriyas, Vaiśyas, and Śūdras; the more modern word for ‘caste’ being jāti; cf. IW. 210 n. 1), ib.
a letter, sound, vowel, syllable, word, Br.; Prāt. &c.
a musical sound or note (also applied to the voice of animals), MBh.; R.; Pañcat.
the order or arrangement of a song or poem, W.
praise, commendation, renown, glory, Mṛcch.; Kum.; Rājat.
(in alg.) an unknown magnitude or quantity
(in arithm.) the figure, ‘one’
(accord. to some) a co-efficient
a kind of measure, L. (cf. -ताल)
gold, L.
a religious observance, L.
one who wards off, expeller, Sāy. on RV. i, 104, 2
व/र्ण n. saffron, L.
वर्ण [Cf., accord. to some, Slav. vranǔ, ‘black’, ‘a crow’; Lith. várnas, ‘a crow’.]
nAv: नाव् in comp. for 2. नौ before vowels.
raRam: 1. र/ण m. delight, pleasure, gladness, joy, RV.; VS.; AV.
र/ण n. battle (as an object of delight), war, combat, fight, conflict, RV.; &c.
2. रण m. (for 1. See p. 863, col. 3) sound, noise, L.
the quill or bow of a lute (= कोण), L.
jAni: जानि mfn. ifc. (Pāṇ. v, 4, 134) = ज/नि, a wife, Ragh. xv, 61 (अन्-अन्य—जानि mfn. ‘having no other wife’), Kathās. iic; Rājat. i, 258
cf. अरुन्धती, भ/द्रयु/व, वि/-, वित्त/-, सुम/ज्-, सप्त/-
havana: 1. हवन m. (for 2. See p. 1294, col. 1) fire or Agni the god of fire, L.
हवन (अम्), n. the act of offering an oblation with fire, sacrifice, MBh.; Hariv.
2. ह/वन m. N. of a Rudra, MBh.; Hariv.
ह/वन n. calling, invocation, summons, RV.; Pañcar.
challenging or challenge to battle, MW.
हवल and हवव, N. of partic. high numbers, Buddh.
(sa)mparI: सम्-परी (-परि- √ 5. इ) P. -पर्येति, to go round, circumambulate, R.; to embrace, contain, AV.; to deliberate, ponder, KaṭhUp.
gAna: गान n. singing, song, KātyŚr.; Lāṭy. i, vii; Hariv. 11793; Śiś. ix, 54
a sound, L. (cf. अरण्य-, ऊह-, ऊह्य-.)
namanam: नमन mfn. bending, bowing (ifc.), Śiś. vi, 30 (cf. नृ-)
नमन n. bowing down, sinking, MārkP.
akza: 1. अ/क्ष m. an axle, axis (in this sense also n., L.)
the beam of a balance or string which holds the pivot of the beam
अक्ष [cf. Lat. axis; Gk. ἄξων; Old Germ. ahsa; Mod. Germ. Achse; Lith. assis.]
2. अक्ष/ m. (√ 1. अश्, Uṇ.) a die for gambling
a seed of which rosaries are made (cf. इन्द्राक्ष, रुद्राक्ष)
the Elaeocarpus Ganitrus, producing that seed
a weight called कर्ष, equal to 16 māṣas
Beleric Myrobalan (Terminalia Belerica), the seed of which is used as a die
blue vitriol (from its cube-like crystals), L.
3. अक्ष n. an organ of sense
4. अक्ष n. [only ifc. (f(ई). ) for अक्षि], the eye.
ota: 1. ओ/त (for 2. See col. 3) mfn. addressed, invoked, summoned, AV.
2. ओ/त (for 1. See 4. ओ) p.p. of आ-√ वे, p. 156, col. 2.
Ahananam: आ-ह/नन n. the act of striking at, beating, KātyŚr.
a stick for beating a drum, AV. xx, 133, 1.
vavra: वव्र/ mfn. (fr. √ 1. वृ) hiding or concealing one's self, RV.
वव्र/ m. ‘hiding-place’, a cavern, hole, cave, ib.
vAmana: वामन/ mf(आ)n. (of doubtful derivation) dwarfish, small or short in stature, a dwarf, VS. &c. &c.
small, minute, short (also of days), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
bent, inclined, HPariś.
relating to a dwarf or to Viṣṇu (cf. below), treating of him, Pur.
descended from the elephant Vāmana (see below), R.

वामन/ m. ‘the Dwarf’, N. of Viṣṇu in his fifth Avatāra or descent (undertaken to humble the pride of the Daitya Bali [q.v.]; the germ of the story of this incarnation seems to be contained in the 1st book of the ŚBr.; the later legend is given in R. i, 32, 2)
N. of a partic. month, VarBṛS.
of Śiva, MBh. xiv, 193
a dwarfish bull, MaitrS.; TS.
a goat with partic. marks, VarBṛS.
a person born under a partic. constellation, ib.
= काण्ड, L.
Alangium Hexapetalum, L.
N. of a serpent-demon, MBh.
of a son of Garuḍa, ib.
of a son of Hiraṇya-garbha, Hariv.
of one of the 18 attendants of the Sun, L.
of a Dānava, Hariv.
of a Muni, Cat.
of a poet (minister under Jayāpīḍa), Rājat.
(also with भट्ट, आचार्य &c.) of various other scholars and authors &c. (esp. of one of the authors of the Kāśikā-vṛtti, the other being Jayāditya, and of the author of the Kāvyālaṃkāra-vṛtti)
of the elephant that supports the south (or west) quarter, MBh.
of a mountain, MBh.
(pl.) N. of a people, ib. (B. अम्बष्ठ)
वामन/ n. = वामन-पुराण and °नोपपुराण (q.v.)
N. of a place of pilgrimage (called after the dwarf form of Viṣṇu), MBh.
asTAna: अ-स्थान n. non-permanency, inconstancy (as of a sound), Jaim.
an army which has lost its chief, L.
anu: 2. अ/नु m. a non-Āryan man, RV.
N. of a king (one of Yayāti's sons)

3. अ/नु ind. (as a prefix to verbs and nouns, expresses) after, along, alongside, lengthwise, near to, under, subordinate to, with. (When prefixed to nouns, especially in adverbial compounds), according to, severally, each by each, orderly, methodically, one after another, repeatedly. (As a separable preposition, with accusative) after, along, over, near to, through, to, towards, at, according to, in order, agreeably to, in regard to, inferior to, Pāṇ. i, 4, 86. (As a separable adverb) after, afterwards, thereupon, again, further, then, next.
anvaya: अन्व्-अय m. (√ इ See अन्व्-√ इ), following, succession
connection, association, being linked to or concerned with
the natural order or connection of words in a sentence, syntax, construing
logical connection of cause and effect, or proposition and conclusion
vala: 1. वल/ m. ‘enclosure’, a cave, cavern, RV.; AV.; Br.
a beam or pole, KātyŚr., Sch.
N. of a demon (brother of Vṛtra, and conquered by Indra; in later language called बल, q.v.)
vamram: वम्र/ m. (and f(ई). accord. to some also f(आ). ; derivation fr. √ वम् very doubtful, cf. वामी) an ant, RV.; Br.
वम्र/ m. N. of a man, RV. (with वैखानस, the supposed author of x, 99).
svavaSaM: स्व—वश mf(आ)n. (for स्ववश See p. 1282) having control of one's self, self-controlled, subject to one's self or to one's own will, independent, free (-ता f.), MBh.; R. &c.
स्व्-अवश mfn. (for स्व-व्° See p. 1276, col. 3) not at all master of one's self, Vās.
yUpa: यू/प m. (prob. fr. √ युप्; but according to Uṇ. iii, 27, fr. √ 2. यु) a post, beam, pillar, (esp.) a smooth post or stake to which the sacrificial victim is fastened, any sacrificial post or stake (usually made of bamboos or Khadira wood; in R. i, 13, 24; 25, where the horse sacrifice is described, 21 of these posts are set up, 6 made of Bilva, 6 of Khadira, 6 of Palāśa, one of Uḍumbara, one of Śleṣmātaka, and one of Deva-dāru), RV. &c. &c.
a column erected in honour of victory, a trophy (= जय-स्तम्भ), L.
N. of a partic. conjunction of the class Ākṛti-yoga (i.e. when all the planets are situated in the 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th houses), VarBṛS.
camana: चमन n. sipping, Jaim. iii, 5, 22, Sch.
tala: तल (m., L.) n. (√ स्तृ) surface, level, flat roof (of a house), MBh. &c. (chiefly ifc. [f(आ). , R. v, 13] cf. नभस्-, मही- &c.)
the part underneath, lower part, base, bottom, Mn. ii, 59; VarBṛS.; Pañcat. &c. (cf. अधस्-, तरु- &c.)
तल m. n. the palm (of the hand See कर-, पाणि-), R. ii, 104, 17; Śak.; Ragh. vi, 18
the sole (of the foot, अङ्घ्रि-, पाद-), MBh. i; VarBṛS.
(without कर- &c.) the palm of the hand (अन्यो ऽन्यस्य, or परस्परं तलं or °लान्-√ दा, to slap each other with the palms of the hands), MBh.; Hariv.; R.; Suśr.
तल m. n., L. the sole of the foot, R. v, 13, 47
= ताल (a span, L.; the handle of a sword, L.; the palmyra tree, Viddh. ii, 13)
pressing the strings of a lute with the left hand, MBh. viii
N. of a hell, ĀruṇUp.; ŚivaP. (cf. तलातल)
N. of a teacher g. शौनकादि
the root or seed of events, L.
varRaja: वर्ण—ज mfn. produced from castes, VarBṛS.
jAm: जा f. a race, tribe, AV. v, 11, 10
जा mfn. (Ved. for 2. ज cf. Pāṇ. iii, 2, 67) ifc. ‘born, produced’, see अग्र-, अद्रि-, अप्सु-जा/ &c.
जा (आ/स्), m. f. offspring, pl. descendants, RV.
samA: समा , (आ), f. a year, see समा p. 1153
स/मा f. (of 2. सम above) a year, RV. &c. &c. (also सम n. in पाप-स/म, पुण्य-स्°, सु-ष/म)
Danam: ध/न n. the prize of a contest or the contest itself (lit. a running match, race, or the thing raced for; हित/ं ध/नम्, a proposed prize or contest; धनं-√ जि, to win the p° or the fight), RV.
booty, prey (धनम्-√ भृ Ā., to carry off the prize or booty), RV.; AV.
any valued object, (esp.) wealth, riches, (movable) property, money, treasure, gift, RV. &c. &c.
capital (opp. to वृद्धि interest), Yājñ. ii, 58
(arithm.) the affirmative quantity or plus (opp. to ऋण, क्षय, व्यय, हानि)
ध/न m. N. of a merchant, HPariś.; Siṃhās.
nASya[m]: नाश्य mfn. liable to be destroyed or removed or banished, Bhāṣāp.; Kap. (-त्व n.)
param: (with abl.) beyond, after (e.g. परं विज्ञानात्, beyond human knowledge; अस्तम्-अयात् प्°, after sunset; मत्तः प्°, after me; अतः प्° or परम् अतः, after this, farther on, hereafter, next; इतः प्°, henceforward, from now; ततः प्° or ततश् च प्°, after that, thereupon; नास्मात् प्° [for मास्मात् प्°], no more of this, enough), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
in a high degree, excessively, greatly, completely, ib.
rather, most willingly, by all means, ib.
I will, so be it, Divyāv.
at the most, at the utmost, merely, no more than, nothing but, ib.

but, however, otherwise (परं तु or परं किं तु id.; यदि प्°, if at all, perhaps, at any rate; न-प्°, not-but; न प्°अरं-अपि, not only-but also; परं न-अपि न, not only not-but not even; न प्°अरं-यावत्, not only-but even), ib.
Avaham: आ-वह mf(आ)n. bringing, bringing to pass, producing
what bears or conveys, Mn.; Bhag.; R.; Pañcat. &c.
आ-वह m. N. of one of the seven winds or bands of air (that which is usually assigned to the भुवर्-लोक or atmospheric region between the भूर्-लोक and स्वर्-लोक), Hariv.
one of the seven tongues of fire.
nATa: नाथ/ n. refuge, help, AV.; TBr.
नाथ/ m. a protector, patron, possessor, owner, lord (often ifc., esp. in names of gods and men, e.g. गोविङ्द-, जगन्- &c.; but also mf(आ)n. possessed of occupied by, furnished with, cf. स-)
नाथ/ m. a husband (esp. in voc.), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
a rope passed through the nose of a draft ox, L.
sAha: 1. साह mfn. (fr. √ सह्) powerful, mighty, RV.
(also षाह ifc.) resisting, conquering, subduing, MBh.
2. साह m. = شاه (see प्रदीप- and मधुकर-स्°).
vallaBa: वल्लभ mf(आ)n. (Uṇ. iii, 125) beloved above all, desired, dear to (gen. loc., or comp.), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
a favourite, friend, lover, husband, Kāv.; Kathās. &c.
a cowherd, L. (prob. w.r. for बल्लव)
a horse (esp. one with good marks or a favourite horse), L.
N. of a son of Balākāśva, MBh.
of the founder of a Vaiṣṇava sect (= वल्लभाचार्य, q.v.)
of a grammarian and various other writers and teachers (also with गणक and न्यायाचार्य), Cat.
Baya: भय/ n. (√ भी) fear, alarm, dread apprehension
fear of (abl. gen. or comp.) or for (comp.), RV. &c. &c. (°यात् ind. ‘from fear’; भयं-√ कृ with abl. ‘to have fear of’; भयं-√ दा, ‘to cause fear, terrify’)
sg. and pl. terror, dismay, danger, peril, distress
danger from (abl. or comp.) or to, (comp.), ib.
the blossom of Trapa Bispinosa, L.

भय/ m. Fear personified (as a Vasu, a son of Nir-ṛti or Ni-kṛti, a prince of the Yavanas and husband of the daughter of Time), Pur. (also n.; and f(आ). as a daughter of Kāla or Vaivasvata, and wife of the Rākṣasa Heti).
saMjvara: सं-ज्वर m. great heat or fever (also applied to the heat of anger or any violent agitation; °रं-√ कृ, ‘to feel agitated’), Mn. (in अ-स्°, q.v.), Kāv.; Kathās. &c.
hataM: हत/ mfn. struck, beaten (also said of a drum), smitten, killed, slain, destroyed, ended, gone, lost (often ibc. = ‘destitute of’, ‘bereft of’, ‘-less’), RV. &c. &c.
injured, marred, hurt, wounded (lit. and fig.), MBh.; Kathās.
hit by (instr. or comp.), Kāv.; Kathās.
visited or afflicted or tormented by, struggling with, suffering from (instr. or comp.), ŚBr.; ChUp.; MBh. &c.
(in astron.) touched, come into contact, VarBṛS.
violated (sexually, as a woman), MBh. viii, 2037
ruined, undone, hopeless, miserable, wretched (of persons and things; cf. comp.), Mn.; MBh. &c.
deprived of, lapsed from (-तस् or comp.), MBh.; R.
हत/ (अम्), n. striking, killing, hurting, W.
ahAvas: अहा/वस् ind. an interjection said to sound like a flourish at the end of a Sāman verse, ŚBr. iv.
Satam: शत/ n. (rarely m.; ifc. f(ई). ) a hundred (used with other numerals thus, एकाधिकं शतम्, or एक-श्°, a h° + one, 101 विंशत्य्-अधिकं शतम् or विंशं श्°, a h° + twenty, 120; शते or द्वे शते or द्वि-शतम् or शत-द्वयम्, 200; त्रीणि शतानि or त्रि-शतानि or शत-त्रयम्, 300; षट्-शतम्, 600; or the comp. becomes an ordinal, e.g. द्वि-शत, the 200th; द्विकं, त्रिकं शतम् = 2, 3 per cent; शतात्पर, ‘beyond a h°, exceeding 100’; the counted object is added either in the gen., or in the same case as शत, or ibc., e.g. शतम् पितरः or शतम् पितॄणाम् or पितृ-शतम् ‘a h° ancestors’; sometimes also ifc. See comp. below; rarely शतम् is used as an indecl. with an instr., e.g. शत/ं र/थेभिः, ‘with a h° chariots’, RV. i, 48, 7; rarely occurs a masc. form in pl., e.g. पञ्च-शतान् रथान्, MBh. iv, 1057; and शत n. rarely in comp. of the following kind, चतुर्-वर्ष-शतम् or °तानि, ‘400 years’), RV. &c.;
any very large number (in comp. as शत-पत्त्र &c. below).
शत [cf. Gk. ἑ-κατόν ‘one’ hundred; Lat. centum; Lith. szìmtas; Got. (twa) hunḍa; Germ. hund-ert; Eng. hund-red.]
kavaza: कव/ष mf(ई/)n. opened (as the legs), AitBr.

(or कवष ऐलूष) N. of a Ṛṣi (son of Ilūṣa by a slave girl, and author of several hymns in the tenth Maṇḍala of the Ṛg-veda; when the Ṛṣis were performing a sacrifice on the banks of the Sarasvatī he was expelled as an impostor and as unworthy to drink of the water, being the son of a slave; it was only when the gods had shown him special favour that he was readmitted to their society), RV. vii, 18, 12; AitBr. ii, 19
N. of the author of a Dharma-śāstra.
asamAna: अ/-समान mf(आ)n. unequal (by birth or in qualities), different, VS. v, 23, &c.
अ/-समान n. not a similar or corresponding condition, Mṛcch.
fca: ऋच ifc. = 2. ऋ/च्, verse, sacred verse (cf. त्र्यृच, &c.)
ऋच m. N. of a king, VP.
uzRa: उष्ण/ mf(आ, rarely ई)n. (Uṇ. iii, 2) hot, warm
ardent, passionate, impetuous, RV. x, 4, 2; AV. vi, 68, 1; viii, 9, 17; ŚBr.; ChUp.; Suśr.; Mn. &c.
उष्ण/ (अस्, अम्),m. n. heat, warmth, the hot season (June, July), Mn. xi, 113; Śak.; Daś. &c.
N. of certain positions in the retrograde motion of the planet Mars, VarBṛS.
Ajani: आ/जनि f. a stick for driving, AV. iii, 25, 5.
ASa[m]: 1. आश m. (√ 1. अश्), reaching, obtaining (cf. दुर्°.)
eating, ŚBr.; KātyŚr. &c. (cf. प्रातर्-आश, सायम्-आश, &c.; हुताश, आश्रयाश, &c.)
astam: अ/स्तम् ind. at home, home, RV. &c., especially used with verbs, e.g. अ/स्तम्-√ इ [अ/स्तम् ए/ति; pr. p. अस्तं-य/त्, AV.; ŚBr.; fut. p. अस्तम्-एष्य/त्, AV.; perf. p. अ/स्तमित See below s.v.]; अ/स्तं-√ गम् [अ/स्तम् ग/च्छति, AV. &c.; perf. p. अस्तं-गत, MBh. &c., once in reversed order गत अस्तं, R. i, 33, 21] or अस्तं-√ या [pr. p. -यात्, Mn. iv, 37] to go down, set, RV.; AV. &c.
Saram: शर/ m. (fr. √ शॄ ‘to rend’ or ‘destroy’) a sort of reed or grass, Saccharum Sara (used for arrows), RV. &c. &c.
an arrow, shaft, MuṇḍUp.; Mn.; MBh. &c.
N. of the number ‘five’ (from the 5 arrows of the god of love), VarBṛS.
(in astron.) the versed sine of an arc (accord. to Āryabh. also ‘the whole diameter with subtraction of the versed sine’)
a partic. configuration of stars (when all the planets are in the 4th, 5th, 6th, and 7th houses), VarBṛS.
the upper part of cream or slightly curdled milk (v.l. सर), ĀpŚr.; Car.
mischief, injury, hurt, a wound, W.
N. of a son of Ṛcatka, RV.
amavat: अ/म—वत् mfn. (अ/म-) impetuous, violent, strong, RV.
sadA: स/दा ind. always, ever, every time, continually, perpetually (with न, ‘never’), RV. &c. &c.
ana[m]: 1. अन्-, occasionally अन-, (before a vowel) the substitute for 3. अ, or अ privative.
अन/ m. breath, respiration, ŚBr.; ChUp.
AhAva: आ-हाव &c. See आ-√ हु & आ-√ ह्वे.
1. आ-हाव/ m. a trough, pail, vessel, RV.
a trough near a well for watering cattle, Pāṇ.
2. आ-हाव m. a particular invocation (शोंसावोम् corrupt from शंसाव, ‘let us two pray!’) by which the Hotṛ addresses the Adhvaryu, AitBr.; ĀśvŚr. (cf. आ-ह्वान)
Danva: धन्व n. = ध/न्वन् (Uṇ. iv, 95, Sch.; esp. at the beginning and at the end of comp.; cf. इषु-, तिसृ-, प्रिय-.; also f(आ). in धन्वाभिस्, Hariv. 7315 v.l. °वीभिस्)
धन्व m. N. of a man, Rājat. v, 51; 56.
nat: नत् mfn. (√ नम्) bowing, bowing one's self (ifc.), MW.
sAva: साव/ m. (fr. √ 3. सु) a Soma libation (cf. प्रातः- and सहस्र-स्°), RV.
aka: 2. अ/-क n. unhappiness, pain, trouble, TS.
yajas: य/जस् n. worship, sacrifice, RV. viii, 40, 4 (= याग, Sāy.)
rasaya: 1. रस् (cf. √ 1. रास्) cl. 1. P. (Dhātup. xvii, 63) रसति (rarely Ā. °ते; pf. ररास, रेसुः, MBh. &c.; aor. अरासीत् or अरसीत् Gr.; fut. रसिता, रसिष्यति, ib.; inf. रसितुम्, ib.), to roar, yell, cry, sound, reverberate, ŚBr. &c. &c.; to praise, Naigh. iii, 14 : Caus. रासयति (aor. अरीरसत्), Gr.: Desid. रिरसिषति, ib. : Intens. रारस्यते (or रारस्ति, Gr.), to cry out loudly, scream aloud, Bhaṭṭ.

2. रस् (rather Nom. fr. रस below) cl. 10. P. (Dhātup. xxxv, 77) रस/यति (rarely Ā. °ते ep. also रसति and रस्यति), to taste, relish, ŚBr.; Up.; MBh. &c.; to feel, perceive, be sensible of Sāh.; to love, Dhātup. : Desid. रिरसयिषति, to desire to taste, Śiś.
yata[m]: यत/ mfn. restrained, held in, held forth, kept down or limited, subdued, governed, controlled &c., RV. &c. &c. (cf. comp. below)
the spurring or guiding of an elephant by means of the rider's feet, L.
dAda: दाद m. (√ दद्) gift, donation, MBh. ix, 2117; 2269 (B. दाय), Śiś. xix, 114.
nava[m]: 1. न/व mf(आ)n. (prob. fr. 1. नु/) new, fresh, recent, young, modern (opp. to सन, पुराण), RV. &c. &c. (often in comp. with a subst., e.g. नवान्न cf. Pāṇ. ii, 1, 49; or with a pp. in the sense of ‘newly, just, lately’ e.g. नवोदित, below)
न/व m. a young monk, a novice, Buddh.
N. of a son of Uśīnara and Navā, Hariv.
of a son of Viloman, VP.
नव [cf. Zd. nava; Gk. νέος for νέϝος; Lat. novus; Lith. naújas; Slav. nǒvǔ; Goth. niujis; Angl.Sax. nîwe; HGerm. niuwi; niuwe, neu; Eng. new.]
2. नव m. (√ 4. नु) praise, celebration, L.
4. न/व in त्रि-णव, q.v. &c. in comp. = °वन्.
ASI: 3. आ-√ शी Ā. (irr. -श/ये [3. sg.] RV.; AV. : Impv. 3. sg. आ-शयाम्, AV. v, 25, 9; 3. pl. -शेरते, Vikr.) to lie or rest on or round: P. (impf. 3. pl. आशयन्) to wish, BhP. ix, 1, 37 [perhaps this form is rather a Nom. from 1. आशा?] : Caus. (impf. आ/शीशयत्) to lay or put upon, R.
naBaM: नभ m. (rather fr. √ नभ् denoting ‘bursting forth’ or ‘expanding’ than fr. √ नह् ‘connecting’, scil. heaven and earth) the sky, atmosphere (= नभस्), L.
N. of a son of Manu Svārociṣa or of the 3rd M° (together with Nabhasya), Hariv.
of one of 7 sages of the 6th Manv-antara, ib.
of a demon (son of Vipra-citti by Siṃhikā), ib.; VP.
of a son of Nala (Niṣadha) and father of Puṇḍarīka (cf. नभस्), Hariv.; BhP.
AraRa[m]: आ/रण n. (probably connected with अरण) depth, abyss, precipice, RV. i, 112, 6 and viii, 70, 8.
AnAya: आ-नाय m. a fisherman's net, Pāṇ.
Canna: छन्न mfn. covered, covered over, MBh. iii, 800; R. i f.; Megh.; BhP. &c. (ifc. cf. Pāṇ. vi, 2, 170)
obscured (the moon), MBh. i, 2699; Sūryas. iv, 10 and 22
hidden, unnoticed by (dat.), secret, clandestine, disguised, MBh. iii f.; R. ii, v; BhP.; Kathās.; Rājat.
छन्न ind. (with √ गै, to sing) privately, in a low voice, Lāṭy. iii, 1, 12 ff.
rARI: राणी f. (corruption of राज्ञी, q.v.) a queen.
udaraM: उद/र n. (√ दॄ, Uṇ. v, 19; √ ऋ, BRD. & T.), the belly, abdomen, stomach, bowels, RV.; AV.; ŚBr.; Suśr.; MBh.; Kathās. &c.
the interior or inside of anything (उदरे, inside, in the interior), Pañcat.; Śak.; Ragh.; Mṛcch. &c.
enlargement of the abdomen (from dropsy or flatulence), any morbid abdominal affection (as of the liver, spleen &c.; eight kinds are enumerated), Suśr.
the thick part of anything (e.g. of the thumb), Suśr. Comm. on Yājñ.
avacara: अव-चर m. the dominion or sphere or department of (in comp. See कामावचर, ध्यानाव्°, &c.), Buddh. (cf. तालावचर and यज्ञावचर/.)
CAya: छाय m. granting shade (Śiva), MBh. xii, 10374
छाय n. (Pāṇ. ii, 4, 22 and 25; vi, 2, 14) ifc. (especially after a word to be taken in the gen.) shadow, Mn. iii, 274; Ragh. iv, 20; vii, 4; xii, 50
ni: 1. नि/ ind. down, back, in, into, within (except, AV. x, 8, 7 always prefixed either to verbs or to nouns; in the latter case it has also the meaning of negation or privation [cf. ‘down-hearted’ = heartless]; sometimes w.r. for निस्)
it may also express क्षेप, दान, उप-रम, आ-श्रय, मोक्ष &c., L.
नि [cf. Zd. ni; Gk. ἐ-νί; Slav. ni-zu; Germ., ni-dar, ni-der, nieder; Angl.Sax. ni-ther, Eng. ne-ther, be-neath.]
svaDA: स्व—धा , see p. 1278, col. 1, and s.v.
स्व-धा/ f. (for स्वधा/ See p. 1280) self-position, self-power, inherent power (accord. to some, N. of Nature or the material Universe; स्व-ध/या ‘by self-power’), RV.
own state or condition or nature, habitual state, custom, rule, law, RV.

ease, comfort, pleasure (अ/नु स्वधा/म्, स्वधा/म् अ/नु or स्वधा/ अ/नु, स्वध/या, or स्वधा/भिः, ‘according to one's habit or pleasure, spontaneously, willingly, easily, freely, undisturbedly, wantonly, sportively’), RV.; AV.; VS.; TBr.
own place, home (स्वधे/ du. ‘the two places or homes’, heaven and earth, Naigh. iii, 30), ib.

‘own portion or share’, the sacrificial offering due to each god, (esp.) the food or libation, or refreshing drink (cf. 2. सु-धा) offered to the Pitṛs or spirits of deceased ancestors (consisting of clarified butter &c. and often only a remainder of the Havis; also applied to other oblations or libations, and personified as a daughter of Dakṣa and wife of the Pitṛs or of Aṅgiras or of a Rudra or of Agni), RV. &c. &c.

स्व-धा (-धा), ind. (with dat. or gen.) the exclamation or benediction used on presenting (or as a substitute for) the above oblation or libation to the gods or departed ancestors (accord. to Mn. iii, 252 the highest form of benediction at a Śrāddha; with √ कृ, ‘to pronounce the exclamation or benediction स्व-धा’; स्वधास्तु, ‘let there be a blessing on it’ [cf. RTL. 104, n. 1]), RV.; &c.
स्वधा/ f. (for स्व-धा see p. 1278, col. 1) an axe, knife, TS.
tagara: तकरी (also तगर, °रक or तगरी) = स्थकर or स्थगर, a partic. fragrant powder (Bloomfield's, AV., p. 311).
तगर n. (m., L.) = °रक, Kauś. 16; MBh. xiii, 5042; Buddh.; Suśr.; VarBṛS. lxxvii, 5 ff.
Ajaka: आजक n. a flock of goats, Pāṇ. iv, 2, 39.
paRa[m]: पण m. (ifc. f(आ). ) play, gaming, playing for a stake, a bet or a wager (with gen.; loc. or ifc.; पणं-√ कृ, to make a bet; पणे नि-√ अस्, to stake at play), Yājñ.; MBh.; R. &c.
a compact, stipulation, agreement, treaty, Kathās.; Vet.; Hit.
the thing staked or the sum played for, wages, hire, reward, MBh.; Mṛcch.; Kathās.
a weight of copper used as a coin (= 20 Māṣas = 4 Kākinīs), Mn.; Yājñ.
a partic. measure, Pāṇ. iii, 3, 66 (‘a handful’ Sch.)
a house, dwelling (गृह w.r. for ग्लह?), L.
me: 1. मे cl. 1. Ā. (Dhātup. xxii, 65) मयते (ep. also P. मयति; pf. ममे Gr.; aor. अमास्त, ib.; fut. माता, मास्यते, ib.; ind.p. -मित्य or -माय, ib.). to exchange, barter (cf. अप-. and नि-√ मे) : Caus. मापयति, ib. : Desid. मित्सते, ib. : Intens. मेमीयते, मामेति, मामाति, ib.
2. मे (onomat.) imitative of the sound of a bleating goat (मे-मे-√ कृ, to bleat), Kāv.
Avaya: आवय/ n. (fr. 2. अ-वी cf. आवि), pangs of childbirth, painful childbirth (?), AV. viii, 6, 26
vAra: 1. वा/र m. (earlier form of वाल, q.v.) the hair of any animal's tail (esp. of a horse's tail, = οὐρά), RV.
वा/र m. n. sg. and pl. a hair-sieve, ib.
2. वार m. (fr. √ 1. वृ) keeping back, restraining (also mfn. ifc. = difficult to be restrained, TBr.; cf. दुर्-व्°)
anything which covers or surrounds or restrains, a cover, MW.
anything which causes an obstruction, a gate, door-way, W.
anything enclosed or circumscribed in space or time, esp. an appointed place (e.g. स्व-वारं समा-√ स्था, to occupy one's proper place), R.

the time fixed or appointed for anything (accord. to some fr. √ 2. वृ, to choose), a person's turn, MBh.; Kāv. &c. (often, esp. with numerals, = times, e.g. वरांस् त्रीन् or वर-त्रयम्, three times; भूरिभिर् वारैः or भूरि-वारान् or बहु-वारम् or वारं वारम् or वारं वारेण, many times, often, repeatedly)

the turn of a day (under the regency of a planet), a day of the week (they are Āditya-, Soma-, Maṅgala-, Budha-, Guru-, Śukra-, and Śani-vāra; cf. IW. 178 n. 1), Gaṇit.; Yājñ., Sch.; Kāv. &c. (cf. दिन and दिवस-व्°)
वार n. a vessel for holding spirituous liquor, L.
anything chosen or choice or exquisite, goods, treasure, RV. (often ifc.; cf. अशस्त-, ऋधद्-, दाति-व्° &c.)
kamala: क/मल mfn. (Comm. on Uṇ. i, 106) pale-red, rose-coloured, TS. vii, 3, 18, 1
क/मल (अस्), m. a species of deer, L.
of a pupil of Vaiśampāyana, Kāś.
क/मल (अस्, अम्), m n. a lotus, lotus-flower, Nelumbium, Suśr.; Śak.; Bhartṛ. &c.
क/मल f(ई)n. N. of a metre (four times three short syllables)
क/मल (अम्), n. a particular constellation, VarBṛ.
N. of a town built by Kamalā, Rājat.
maDu: म/धु mf(ऊ or उ or वी)n. (gen. n. Ved. म/ध्वस्, म/धोस्, or म/धुनस्; instr. म/ध्वा; dat. म/धुने; loc. म/धौ) sweet, delicious, pleasant, charming, delightful, RV.; TS.
bitter or pungent, L.
म/धु m. N. of the first month of the year (= Caitra, March-April), ŚBr. &c. &c.
the season of spring, Var.; Kālid.
Bassia Latifolia, L.
Jonesia Asoka, L.
liquorice, L.
N. of Śiva, MBh.
of two Asuras (the one killed by Viṣṇu, the other by Śatru-ghna), MBh.; Hariv.; Pur.
of one of the 7 sages under Manu Cākṣuṣa, MārkP.
of a son of the third Manu, Hariv.
of various princes (of a son of Vṛṣa, of Deva-kṣatra, of Bindu-mat, of Arjuna Kārtavīrya), Hariv.; Pur.
of a son of Bhaṭṭa-nārāyaṇa, Kṣitīś.; of a teacher (= मध्व or अनन्द-तीर्थ), Col.
of a mountain, MārkP.
(pl.) the race of Madhu (= the Yādavas or Māthuras), MBh.; Hariv.; BhP.
म/धु (उ) f. a partic. plant (= जीवा or जीवन्ती), L.
म/धु n. anything sweet (esp. if liquid), mead &c., RV.; AV.; TBr.
Soma (also सोम्यम् मधु), RV.
honey (said to possess intoxicating qualities and to be of 8 kinds; मधुनो लेह m. licker of honey a bee, W.), RV. &c. &c.
milk or anything produced from milk (as butter, ghee &c.), RV.; VS.; GṛŚrS.
the juice or nectar of flowers, any sweet intoxicating drink, wine or spirituous liquor, Kāv.; Var.; Sāh.
sugar, L.
water, L.
pyrites, Bhpr.
N. of a Brāhmaṇa, ŚBr.; a kind of metre, Col.
मधु [cf. Gk., μέθυ, μέθη, Slav. medǔ; Lith. midùs, medùs; Germ. Meth; Eng. mead.]
aSru: अ/श्रु n. (उस् m. only once, ŚBr. vi and once, R.) a tear, RV. x, 95, 12 and 13; AV. &c. with √ मुच्, or √ कृ [MBh. xii, 12491] or √ वृत्, Caus. [R.] to shed tears
अश्रु [supposed to stand for दश्रु fr. √ दंश्: cf. Gk. δάκρυ; Lat. lacryma for dacryma; Goth. tagrs; Eng. tear; Mod. Germ. Zähre].
BARa[m]: भाण m. (√ भण्) recitation (esp. of the Buddhist law), MWB. 44

N. of a sort of dramatic entertainment (in which only one of the interlocutors appears on the scene, or a narrative of some intrigue told either by the hero or a third person), Daśar.; Sāh.; Pratāp. (cf. IW. 471).
Atan: आ-√ तन् P. (2. sg. -तनोषि; impf. आ/तनोत्; perf. -ततान; p. m. pl. -तन्व/न्तस्; perf. p. m. sg. -ततन्वा/न्) to extend or stretch over, penetrate, spread, overspread (said of the light), illuminate, RV.; (perf. 2. sg. -तत/न्थ) to seek to reach, RV. x, 1, 7; to be ready for, wait on (acc.), RV. v, 79, 3; (aor. Subj. -तनत्) to stop any one, RV. i, 91, 23 : P. Ā. (3. pl. -तन्वते; perf. 1. sg. -ततने) to extend (a texture), spread, stretch (a bow for shooting), RV.; AV. &c.: P. to diffuse; to bestow upon, RV.; BhP. &c.; to effect, produce, Hariv. 4635; BhP. &c.: Caus. (Impv. 2. sg. -तानया) to stretch, AV.
yatam: यत/ mfn. restrained, held in, held forth, kept down or limited, subdued, governed, controlled &c., RV. &c. &c. (cf. comp. below)
the spurring or guiding of an elephant by means of the rider's feet, L.
samaya: 1. समय P. °यति (for 2. See सम्-√ इ), to level, regulate, L.
2. सम्-अय/ m. (ifc. f(आ). ) coming together, meeting or a place of meeting, AV.; ŚBr.

coming to a mutual understanding, agreement, compact, covenant, treaty, contract, arrangement, engagement, stipulation, conditions of agreement, terms (एन or आत् or -तस्, ‘according to agreement, conditionally’; तेन समयेन, ‘in consequence of this agreement’; समयं acc. with √ कृ, ‘to make an agreement or engagement’, ‘agree with any one [instr. with or without सह]’, ‘settle’, ‘stipulate’; with सम्√ वद् id.; with √ दा, ‘to propose an agreement, offer terms’; with √ ब्रू or √ वच् or अभि-√ धा, ‘to state the terms of an agr°’, ‘make a promise’; with √ ग्रह् or प्रति-√ पद्, ‘to enter into an agr°’, ‘make or accept conditions of an agr°’; with √ पाल्, or √ रक्ष् or परि-√ रक्ष् &c., ‘to keep an agr°’, ‘keep one's word’; with √ त्यज् or √ भिद् or व्य्-अभि-√ चर् &c., ‘to break an agr°’; abl. with √ भ्रंश् id.; loc. with √ स्था, ‘to keep an engagement’, ‘keep one's word’; acc. with Caus. of √ स्था or of नि-√ विश् ‘to fix or settle terms’, ‘impose conditions’), TS. &c. &c.
convention, conventional rule or usage, established custom, law, rule, practice, observance, MBh.; R.; BhP.
order, direction, precept, doctrine, Nir.; MBh.; Śaṃk.; Sarvad.
(in rhet.) the conventional meaning or scope of a word, Kusum.

appointed or proper time, right moment for doing anything (gen. or Pot. Pāṇ. iii, 3, 68), opportunity, occasion, time, season (ifc. or ibc. or °ये ind., ‘at the appointed time or at the right moment or in good time for’, or ‘at the time of’, ‘when there is’; तेन समयेन, ‘at that time’), MBh.; Kāv. &c.
juncture, circumstances, case (इह समये, ‘under these circumstances’, ‘in this case’), Pañcat.; Hit.
solemn address, harangue, speech, declaration, Viṣṇ.
(in gram.) a Vedic passage which is the repetition of another one, RPrāt.
(in dram.) end of trouble or distress, Bhar.; Daśar.; Sāh.
N. of a son of Dharma, VP.
(with Śāktas) N. of the author of a Mantra, Cat.
stana: स्त/न m. (or n. g. अर्धर्चादि ifc. आ or ई; derivation doubtful, but prob. connected with √ स्तन्, from the hollow resonance of the human breast), the female breast (either human or animal), teat, dug, udder, RV. &c. &c.
the nipple (of the female or the male breast), Suśr.
a kind of pin or peg on a vessel shaped like a teat, ŚBr.
sajya: स-ज्य mfn. (fr. 7. स + 3. ज्या/, q.v.) having a bow-string, strung (as a bow), placed on the bow-string (as an arrow), Kauś.; MBh. : R. &c.
ayA: अया/ ind. (fr. pronom. base अ = अन/या), in this manner, thus, RV.
Ba[m]: 2. भ (in gram.) N. of the weakest base of nouns (as opp. to पद and अङ्ग, q.v.) i.e. of the base before the vowel terminations except in strong cases, before feminine suffixes, and before Taddhitas beginning with vowels or य्, Pāṇ. i, 4, 18 &c.
4. भ m. (√ 1. भा) N. of the planet Venus or its regent, (= शुक्र), L.
भ n. a star, planet, asterism, lunar a° or mansion (and so also the number 27; cf. नक्षत्र), sign of the zodiac, GṛS.; Sūryas.; Var.; Śatr. &c.
5. भ m. (prob. onomat.) a bee, L.
aha[m]: = अहंकरण, q.v., (hence declinable gen. अहमस्, &c.), BhP.
अहम् [Zd. azem; Gk. ἐγώ; Goth. ik; Mod. Germ. ich; Lith. asz; Slav. az].
rIRa: रीण mfn. melted, dissolved, vanished, Śiś.
vahas: व/हस् n. the shoulder of a draught animal, ŚBr. (v.l. for वह/).
janman: ज/न्मन् n. birth, production (कृत-जन्मन् mfn. ‘planted’, Kum. v, 60), origin (ifc. ‘born from’ e.g. शूद्र. q.v.), RV. iii, 26, 7; vii, 33, 10; AV.; VS. &c.
existence, life, Mn.; Bhag. iv, 5; Yogas. ii, 12 (दृष्टादृष्टज्°, ‘present and future life’), &c. (°म acc. ind. through the whole life, HPariś. iv, 7)
birthplace, home, RV. ii, 9, 3; viii, 69, 3; x, 5, 7; AV.; VS.
(in astrol.) N. of the 1st lunar mansion, civ
a creature, being, RV.; TBr. ii; AitBr. iv, 10
the people of a household, kind, race, RV. (उभ/यज्° sg., du. and pl., ‘both races’ i.e. gods and men or [x, 37, 11] men and animals)
custom, manner (प्रत्ने/न ज/न्मना, according to ancient custom), i, 87, 5; ix, 3, 9; SV. (v.l. मन्म्°, RV.), Hariv. 15718 (दूत-जन्मना, ‘like a messenger’)
sadas: स/दस् n. (accord. to some also f.) a seat, residence, abode, dwelling, place of meeting, assembly (esp. at a sacrifice; स/दसस्-प/ति m. = स/दस्-प/ति; सदसि, ‘in public’), RV. &c. &c.
a shed erected in the sacrificial enclosure to the east of the Prācīnavaṃśa, AV.; VS. : Br.; MBh.; Hariv.
du. heaven and earth (= द्यावा-पृथिवी), Naigh. iii, 30. [cf. Gk. ἕδος.]
iya[m]: इय/म् f. nom. sg. of the demonstrative pronoun इद/म्, q.v.
la: 1. ल the 3rd semivowel (corresponding to the vowels ऌ, ॡ, and having the sound of the English l)

a technical term for all the tenses and moods of a finite verb or for the terminations of those tenses and moods (also applied to some forms with कृत् affixes construed like a finite verb, Pāṇ. ii, 3, 69; cf. iii, 2, 124, and when accompanied by certain indicatory letters denoting each tense separately See लट्; लङ्; लिङ्; लोट्; लिट्; लुट्; ऌट्; लुङ्; ऌङ्; लेट्), Pāṇ. iii, 4, 69; 77, Sch.
2. ल m. N. of Indra, L.
3. ल (in prosody) = लघु, a short syllable.
yavasa: य/वस m. n. grass, fodder, pasturage, RV.; &c.
arA: अरा f. (= आ/रा), an awl Comm. on MBh. xv, 19.
naBam: नभ m. (rather fr. √ नभ् denoting ‘bursting forth’ or ‘expanding’ than fr. √ नह् ‘connecting’, scil. heaven and earth) the sky, atmosphere (= नभस्), L.
N. of a son of Manu Svārociṣa or of the 3rd M° (together with Nabhasya), Hariv.
of one of 7 sages of the 6th Manv-antara, ib.
of a demon (son of Vipra-citti by Siṃhikā), ib.; VP.
of a son of Nala (Niṣadha) and father of Puṇḍarīka (cf. नभस्), Hariv.; BhP.
upayama: उप-यम m. (Pāṇ. iii, 3, 63) appropriation, taking possession of
kindling a fire, (कन्याग्न्य्-उपयम, taking a wife and kindling the domestic fire, Gaut. xviii, 18)
sayana[m]: सयन m. N. of a son of Viśvāmitra, MBh. (B. सेयन).
